70.name: Riding Kodo
70.description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

76.description: Bred for their aggressive, unpredictable demeanor by the Kor'kron stablemasters, the Black War Kodos' trumpeting call signifies that blood will soon be shed.

77.name: Black Battlestrider
77.description: A properly accelerated gnome in battle is a thing of terrible beauty. - High Tinker Mekkatorque

78.name: Black War Ram
78.description: The dwarves value their ram companions for their fearlessness charging into battle.

79.name: Black War Raptor

80.name: Red Skeletal Warhorse
80.description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

82.name: Black War Wolf

83.name: Dreadsteed
83.description: WARNING: It craves only fel energy. Not apples. It hates the seeds.

84.name: Charger
84.description: Redeemed by the Light. Devoted to your cause.

85.description: Some historians claim that this breed's misty grey coat is the result of ancient Highborne experiments conducted on nightsabers.

87.name: Swift Frostsaber

88.name: Swift Yellow Mechanostrider
88.description: We have made a lot of improvements, but they are still based on the Mekkatorque designs. -Milli Featherwhistle

183.name: Ashes of Al'ar
183.description: Al'ar was the beloved pet of Kael'thas Sunstrider, who often boasted that death would never claim it. Perhaps he was right.

185.name: Raven Lord
185.description: The rest be forgotten to walk upon the ground, clipped wings and shame. -Word of the Raven

186.name: Onyx Netherwing Drake
186.description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

187.name: Azure Netherwing Drake
187.description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

191.description: After promising to fly you to the ends of Outland, the netherwing drake was eventually drawn to the blue skies of Azeroth as well.

196.name: Spectral Tiger
196.description: In true goblin fashion, Landro Longshot has put a stranglehold on the distribution of these mysterious incorporeal mounts.

197.name: Swift Spectral Tiger
197.description: Historians claim that these incorporeal beasts were created when Draenor exploded, unleashing energies that warped the world's flora and fauna.

199.name: Amani War Bear
199.description: Only the swiftest heroes venturing into the troll temple of Zul'Aman were able to subdue these rare battle mounts.

201.name: Brewfest Ram
201.description: Brewers retired this mount from active advertising service after complaints that the beasts were "too temperamental" to control in major cities.

202.name: Swift Brewfest Ram
202.description: Dwarves attribute this breed's even temperament to rigorous training, but other races argue that a daily diet of strong ale has something to do with it.

203.name: Cenarion War Hippogryph
203.description: Members of the Cenarion Circle have shared a long and prosperous partnership with their hippogryph allies. When conflict is unavoidable, the Cenarion War Hippogryph is called into service.

204.name: Turbo-Charged Flying Machine
204.description: Only the most talented engineers have the courage and the mental stamina to create a flying machine that boasts stability and safety.  Turbo-charging one is just crazy!

205.name: Flying Machine
205.description: The backbone of the Alliance air force is comprised predominantly of gnomish flying machines due to their maneuverability and speed.

206.name: Merciless Nether Drake
206.description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

207.name: Merciless Nether Drake
207.description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

211.name: X-51 Nether-Rocket
211.description: First designed as a booster for a much larger rocket, the X-51 was determined to give the perfect thrust capacity for a single rider payload.

212.name: X-51 Nether-Rocket X-TREME
212.description: What it lacks in safety features it more than makes up for in speed and style.  Not for the faint of heart.

213.name: Swift White Hawkstrider
213.description: I may question Prince Kael'thas's loyalties, but never his style. -Elrodan

219.name: Headless Horseman's Mount
219.description: Be it into the flood, or into the fire, this one will go where you require.

220.name: Black War Elekk
220.description: Uniquely aggressive and pugnacious elekk bulls are culled from the herd and sold to Ethereal traders. The traders then train the bulls for combat and sell them to owners unconcerned about safety.

221.name: Acherus Deathcharger
221.description: Some horses merely adopt the dark. This horse was born in it, molded by it.

222.name: Swift Zhevra
222.description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

223.name: Vengeful Nether Drake
223.description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

224.name: Swift Zhevra
224.description: Zhevras are rarely used as mounts in Azeroth due to their stubborn nature and tendency to bite.

225.name: Brewfest Riding Kodo
225.description: You can't remember exactly how you got this mount. Then again, you can't remember much of anything that happens at Brewfest.

226.name: Great Brewfest Kodo
226.description: Coren Direbrew won this prize after drinking a Tauren druid under the table - and the druid was in bear form. It was one of Direbrew's proudest moments.

230.name: Big Battle Bear
230.description: He's big, he's ready for battle, and he's a bear. What more could you want in a mount?

236.name: Winged Steed of the Ebon Blade
236.description: Dead or alive, you're coming with me.

237.name: White Polar Bear
237.description: The frost vrykul believe that wearing a necklace of polar bear claws will grant them otherworldly strength.

238.name: Swift Spectral Gryphon
238.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

240.name: Mechano-Hog
240.description: Difficult to build and to maintain, these hogs more than make up for their expense through sheer cool factor.

241.name: Brutal Nether Drake
241.description: The most aggressive nether drakes were awarded those heroes who showed significant prowess and commitment in the gladiatorial arena.

243.name: Big Blizzard Bear
243.description: Whenever you ride this mount, you feel the urge to shout, "Cry havoc and let slip the murlocs of war!"

246.name: Azure Drake
246.description: Always speak politely to an enraged dragon.

247.name: Blue Drake
247.description: Come not between the dragon and his wrath.

248.name: Bronze Drake
248.description: Lost time is never found again. Oh, never mind I found it. -Chronormu

249.name: Red Drake
249.description: You should never listen to minstrels' fancies. A dragon would never hurt a soul, unless they tried to hurt him first.

250.name: Twilight Drake
250.description: But the most important rule, the rule you can never forget, no matter how much he cries, no matter how much he begs, never feed him after midnight.

251.name: Black Polar Bear
251.description: The taunka use black polar bear pelts in their religious rites, usually at the funerals of those who hunt black polar bears.

253.name: Black Drake
253.description: It never pays to leave a live dragon out of the equation.

254.name: Black War Mammoth
254.description: Normally placid beasts, these intelligent animals form a strong bond with their riders, making them loyal and fearless in battle.

255.name: Black War Mammoth
255.description: Sure-footed and unflappable, these dark-furred mammoths are prized for their steady temperament going into battle.

256.name: Wooly Mammoth
256.description: Directly descended from the original progenitor of the mammoth race, wooly mammoths are considered more feral and primal than their shorter-haired cousins.

257.name: Wooly Mammoth
257.description: This wild variant of the mammoth is not bred for riding. Most wooly mammoths are captured in the wild and tamed by their riders, resulting in a fierce, cunning mount.

258.name: Ice Mammoth
258.description: The Sons of Hodir believe that riding an ice-white mammoth will protect the rider from frostbite and snow blindness.

259.name: Ice Mammoth
259.description: Many ice giants claim that they have trained their favored white mammoths to trigger avalanches with their trumpeting calls.

262.name: Red Proto-Drake
262.description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

263.name: Black Proto-Drake
263.description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed exceptional resilience and fortitude facing the dangers in Northrend.

264.name: Blue Proto-Drake
264.description: The Storm Peaks! There we will find the beast strong enough to bear me into battle. -Skadi the Ruthless

265.name: Time-Lost Proto-Drake
265.description: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.

266.name: Plagued Proto-Drake
266.description: Bred specifically to honor those heroes who showed significant courage and persistence facing the dangers in Northrend.

267.name: Violet Proto-Drake
267.description: I cannot help but wonder if things would have turned out different if the titans had elevated even one more dragonflight. -Alexstrasza

268.name: Albino Drake
268.description: Even the Draconic Native Association tests proved inconclusive in determining if the albino drake is related to a known dragonflight. -Breanni

269.name: Armored Brown Bear
269.description: This ursine mount's swiftness is enhanced by its heavy armor, imbued with magic from Kirin Tor magi.

270.name: Armored Brown Bear
270.description: Your cries of "For the Horde!" will be much more menacing from atop a heavily armored bear that's barreling down on Alliance at top speed.

271.name: Black War Bear
271.description: Killing leaders of the Horde is its own reward, but this intimidating beast is an excellent memento.

272.name: Black War Bear
272.description: This formidable mount is bought with the blood of Alliance leaders, but you would have killed them for free.

273.name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
273.description: Merchants trust only this thundering, mountainous steed to protect them when venturing down Azeroth's most dangerous trade routes.

274.name: Grand Caravan Mammoth
274.description: A common sight on trade routes all across Azeroth, this calm, stalwart mount is the favorite of merchants traveling to exotic and distant markets.

275.name: Mekgineer's Chopper
275.description: Sporting superb engineering craftsmanship, this chopper is one of the few personal vehicles on Azeroth built for two.

276.name: Armored Snowy Gryphon
276.description: The nice thing is that when they attack, blood almost never stains their feathers. -Mei Francis

277.name: Armored Blue Wind Rider
277.description: They are not native to Northrend, but they have adapted extremely well to the cold. -Mei Francis

278.name: Green Proto-Drake
278.description: The vrykul were the first to recognize their potential. Or maybe the second, depending on how you look at it.

279.name: Magnificent Flying Carpet
279.description: Standard features include a sturdy imbued frostweave frame and real iceweb spider silk threading.  Spare head pillow sold separately.

280.name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
280.description: Ancient manuscripts depict merchants traveling across the frozen tundra with these colossal beasts, leading scholars to believe they are the first domesticated mounts.

284.name: Traveler's Tundra Mammoth
284.description: Riders and merchants alike trust only this strong and steadfast mammoth to carry them safely across the frigid tundra.

285.name: Flying Carpet
285.description: Hop aboard this flying carpet to see the shining, shimmering, and splendid world of Azeroth, wonder by wonder.

286.name: Grand Black War Mammoth
286.description: Once used by giants to carry heavily armored warriors, these grand war mammoths can easily bear more than one rider of less-than-giant stature.

287.name: Grand Black War Mammoth
287.description: Rarely, a war mammoth is born stronger and more tractable than its peers. These mammoths are dubbed "grand" and carry more than one rider to the front lines.

288.name: Grand Ice Mammoth
288.description: At home on the narrow, icy trails of the Storm Peaks, these mammoths are the only mounts the ice giants trust to carry large loads and multiple riders.

289.name: Grand Ice Mammoth
289.description: Due to high winds and avalanches, the Sons of Hodir recommend bringing at least two companions if venturing into the dangerous Storm Peaks.

291.name: Blue Dragonhawk
291.description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

292.name: Red Dragonhawk
292.description: Dragonhawks are among the deadliest known predators. They are able to spot prey from great distances, rush in, and rend with both talon and beak.

293.name: Illidari Doomhawk
293.description: Once a year, a rift in time appears, and strange things occur. The Illidari scouts and Doomwalker were quite surprised to find themselves in Tanaris.

294.name: Stormwind Steed
294.description: Although raised in Stormwind, this breed showed unusual aptitude for the cold weather in Icecrown.

295.name: Darkspear Raptor
295.description: This raptor breed was originally cultivated by the Drakkari, but has since been adopted by the Darkspear tribe in Northrend.

296.name: Ironforge Ram
296.description: Wildhammer Fact Checker claims that this specific breed was the first type of ram domesticated by the dwarves when they settled in Dun Morogh.

297.name: Darnassian Nightsaber
297.description: When a night elf's mount perishes, it is custom for the rider to keep one of the saber's great fangs as a token of remembrance.

298.name: Gnomeregan Mechanostrider
298.description: When you absolutely, positively have to be there right now. -Rillie Spindlenut

299.name: Exodar Elekk
299.description: Exodar Elekk are elekk which have been anointed by O'ros, the Naaru who journeyed from Draenor to Azeroth with Velen and his followers.

300.name: Orgrimmar Wolf
300.description: For a brief time, many orcs would declare themselves "hungry like an Orgrimmar wolf." Some blood elves still use the phrase ironically.

301.name: Thunder Bluff Kodo
301.description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through Mulgore.

302.name: Silvermoon Hawkstrider
302.description: So I says I feel like chicken tonight. Next thing, I am flat out and that thing is trying to see what my eyes taste like. -Bozzle Blastbolt

303.name: Forsaken Warhorse
303.description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

304.name: Mimiron's Head
304.description: A token of titan craftsmanship hoarded by the Old God, Yogg-Saron. Currently the single largest mechanical gnome head in Azeroth.

305.name: Argent Hippogryph
305.description: Argent Hippogryphs will partner with only the bravest and most battle-tested champions.

306.name: Ironbound Proto-Drake
306.description: His skin more hard than brass was found, that sword nor spear could pierce nor wound.

307.name: Rusted Proto-Drake
307.description: Not as shiny as the other one, but it's still a great find lads. Brann Bronzebeard

308.name: Blue Skeletal Warhorse
308.description: A rare sight. Most disappeared once Baron Rivendare ruled in Stratholme.

309.name: White Kodo
309.description: "The kodo is the backbone of our people. Wherever the Horde goes - in trade, settlement, or war - there you will find the mighty kodo." - Harb Clawhoof

310.name: Black Wolf
310.description: Can howl loudly enough to be heard for miles.

311.name: Venomhide Ravasaur
311.description: You raised this thing from a scaly pup - Mor'vek would be so proud. But he'd still make you clean up the mess it made in the corner.

312.name: Sea Turtle
312.description: Often caught by fishermen at a young age, these mounts are much more comfortable in the water than they are on land.

313.name: Deadly Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
313.description: These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it.

314.name: Black Skeletal Horse
314.description: The Forsaken believe that without a purpose, even beasts of burden suffer in undeath.

317.name: Furious Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
317.description: Some of Azeroth's mightiest dragons have been summoned across the veil between life and death to serve new masters with undying loyalty.

318.name: Great Red Elekk
318.description: Never seen in Nagrand, the first red elekk calves were born in Azeroth after the Exodar's arrival. Some breeders theorize that the unique coloration is somehow caused by the same radiation which ravaged Bloodmyst Isle.

319.name: Swift Moonsaber
319.description: Many night elves revere these proud mounts because their shimmering coats symbolize the goddess of the moon, Elune.

320.name: Swift Red Hawkstrider
320.description: What do you mean is it dyed? Oh, the bird. We did touch up the red just a little. -Trellis Morningsun

321.name: Swift Gray Steed
321.description: A veteran of some of the toughest battles fought by the Argent Crusade.

322.name: Great Golden Kodo
322.description: An alpha member of the herd, this kodo is a prime example of the mighty creatures which thunder through the Southern Barrens.

323.name: Turbostrider
323.description: The mirror's not so you can look back, but so your foes can see something besides your tailpipes. -Rillie Spindlenut

324.name: Swift Violet Ram
324.description: The Barak Tor'ol ram's thick bony skull and massive horns make it the ideal mount for charging through groups of armored enemies.

325.name: Swift Purple Raptor
325.description: Longtime allies of the trolls, these jungle hunters form a special bond with their masters. They become mount, guardian, and friend.

326.name: White Skeletal Warhorse
326.description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

327.name: Swift Burgundy Wolf
327.description: The wolves of the Horde are befriended, not domesticated.

328.name: Magic Rooster
328.description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

329.name: Silver Covenant Hippogryph
329.description: Silver Covenant Hippogryphs are fiercely loyal, both to their riding partners, and to the Alliance.

330.name: Sunreaver Dragonhawk
330.description: The Sunreavers of Dalaran select only the swiftest and most formidable of dragonhawks as their mounts.

331.name: Quel'dorei Steed
331.description: Comes from a lineage of fine horses that once grazed near the shores of the Well of Eternity.

332.name: Sunreaver Hawkstrider
332.description: I demand speed, grace and discipline on the battlefield. This one will serve nicely. -Eressea Dawnsinger

333.name: Magic Rooster
333.description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

334.name: Magic Rooster
334.description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

335.name: Magic Rooster
335.description: Magic in the hands of a genius can do wonderful, miraculous things. Magic in the hands of an idiot can make a giant rooster.

336.name: Ochre Skeletal Warhorse
336.description: When fallen heroes are raised into undeath, so too are their horses.

337.name: Striped Dawnsaber
337.description: Night elves once believed that seeing this light colored saber breed in the wild was an ill omen.

338.name: Argent Charger
338.description: Trained to accept only champions of the Light as a rider.

340.name: Relentless Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
340.description: In life, it could not be tamed, but necromancy and esoteric binding rituals have now combined to bend this indomitable creature to its rider's will.

341.name: Argent Warhorse
341.description: Given only to those who prove themselves a champion in the Argent Tournament.

342.name: Swift Horde Wolf
342.description: A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Horde who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.

343.name: Swift Alliance Steed
343.description: A few of the Argent Crusade's swiftest mounts were awarded to those members of the Alliance who performed exceptionally during the tournament in Icecrown.

344.name: Crusader's White Warhorse
344.description: Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Alliance members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.

345.name: Crusader's Black Warhorse
345.description: Awarded to only the most skilled champions from the Trial of the Crusader, these steeds were chosen for Horde members from Tirion Fordring's own personal stable.

349.name: Onyxian Drake
349.description: She has a lot in common with her mother, except for the being killed and reanimated. But she is young still. -Maloriak

350.name: Sunwalker Kodo
350.description: This magnificent beast, adorned in sacred charms and painted with holy imagery, radiates with the warmth of the sun.

351.name: Great Sunwalker Kodo
351.description: At daybreak, the noble Sunwalkers often perform rituals to bless their mounts, imbuing them with holy magic.

352.name: X-45 Heartbreaker
352.description: Apothecary Hummel painted this masterpiece bright pink for an unrequited love.

358.name: Wrathful Gladiator's Frost Wyrm
358.description: Many believe that during their early lives, these wyrms were forced to fight their own kind for the amusement of others. Perhaps that is why they possess a particularly combative temperament.

363.name: Invincible
363.description: The famous steed of Arthas Menethil, who serves its master in life and in death.  Riding him is truly a feat of strength.

364.name: Icebound Frostbrood Vanquisher
364.description: Raised from the chilling depths of Icecrown, Frostbrood Vanquishers are considered among the fiercest and most relentless of all frost wyrms.

365.name: Bloodbathed Frostbrood Vanquisher
365.description: Bloodbathed Vanquishers are so named when it is determined that a reanimated frost wyrm died a particularly gruesome and bloody death.

366.name: Crimson Deathcharger
366.description: Stabled in the Icecrown Citadel to serve the Lich King's most favored minions.

367.name: Exarch's Elekk
367.description: Draenei exarchs have long marched into war atop these imposing mounts, bred for their razor-sharp tusks.

368.name: Great Exarch's Elekk
368.description: Only the most distinguished paladins are given the honor of riding this elekk. Its plated armor and purple adornments have been blessed by Prophet Velen himself.

371.name: Blazing Hippogryph
371.description: Hippogryphs are highly intelligent, sentient beings; far more than mere "mounts."

372.name: Wooly White Rhino
372.description: Captured by Toby "Mother Goose" Ironbolt on the Borean Tundra, this shaggy beast carries an enormous grudge after being bridled by a gnome.

373.name: Vashj'ir Seahorse
373.description: Stubborn until broken, these underwater mounts provide the swiftest means of travel around the depths of Vashj'ir.

375.name: Frosty Flying Carpet
375.description: "I remember my first flying carpet... yeti hair and burlap.  Not nearly as nice as this one here." - Frozo the Renowned

376.name: Celestial Steed
376.description: A beacon of hope; a guiding light in the darkness.

382.name: X-53 Touring Rocket
382.description: Riding a giant cylinder filled with highly explosive goblin rocket fuel all by yourself is just crazy...so bring a friend.

386.name: Fossilized Raptor
386.description: Legends tell of a spell placed upon a hunting raptor who dared to snarl at young Tyrande Whisperwind as she bathed in a jungle pool. The beast is cursed to wander Azeroth -  until it apologizes.

388.name: Goblin Trike
388.description: A compilation of nuts, bolts, gears, and treated wood paneling make for an unusually smooth ride.

389.name: Goblin Turbo-Trike
389.description: The turbo trike's tri-wheel design adds superior stability and a smaller turn radius over its two wheeled cousins.

391.name: Volcanic Stone Drake
391.description: Fire can transform stone in exciting ways, but never let the Stonemother know I said that. -Earthcaller Yevaa

392.name: Drake of the East Wind
392.description: In Deathwing's mad quest to forge new dragons, he ignored amazing breeds never before seen on Azeroth. -Thrall

393.name: Phosphorescent Stone Drake
393.description: The Stonemother has shown little concern for the rebellious Aeonaxx, even allowing his spawn to be taken from her realm.

394.name: Drake of the West Wind
394.description: Harnessing the elemental powers of the storm, these majestic beasts crackle like lightning and roar like thunder.

395.name: Drake of the North Wind
395.description: They sicken of the calm who know the storm.

396.name: Drake of the South Wind
396.description: Gentle as a summer breeze, but that says little considering where it came from. -Itesh

397.name: Vitreous Stone Drake
397.description: Those would be perfect in a pendant, and that would make a fantastic ring. Let me know if this thing sheds or molts or whatever. -Kalinda

398.name: Brown Riding Camel
398.description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

399.name: Tan Riding Camel
399.description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

400.name: Grey Riding Camel
400.description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

401.name: Dark Phoenix
401.description: Despite their name, Dark Phoenixes are known to have a warm and cheerful disposition.

403.name: Golden King
403.description: Don't let the saddle fool you, he's wild, not a tame lion.

404.name: Ultramarine Qiraji Battle Tank
404.description: The Tol'vir sorcerer Azj'Aqir was said to possess a scepter that would allow him to control a Qiraj battle tank outside of its Silithus home.

405.name: Spectral Steed
405.description: Dark spirits flee before the radiance of its presence.

407.name: Sandstone Drake
407.description: Sandstone Drakes were studied in great detail long ago by the famed alchemist Walleye Sprysprocket. It has even been said that Walleye developed potions to mimic the drakes' physiology.

408.name: Mottled Drake
408.description: I thought the thing was ill until it took to the air. It flies as true as any of my own. -Alexstrasza

409.name: Kor'kron Annihilator
409.description: Vicious in battle and surprisingly loyal, this battle scorpion serves only those who show true commitment to a powerful guild.

410.name: Armored Razzashi Raptor
410.description: The purebred royal raptors of Zul'Gurub, these mounts have become a rare sight in Stranglethorn Vale. The Gurubashi have been known to fly into a rage at the sight of any non-troll riding one of their precious beasts.

411.name: Swift Zulian Panther
411.description: The jungle trolls have long coveted panther fangs, using them for rituals or as ingredients in mojos.

412.name: Amani Dragonhawk
412.description: Dragonhawks liberated from troll enslavement are considered among the most loyal of all their kin.

413.name: Flameward Hippogryph
413.description: Flameward Hippogryphs revel in the defeat of Ragnaros, Lord of Fire.

415.name: Pureblood Fire Hawk
415.description: Legends state that the Pureblood line may be traced back to the very creation of the Firelands.

416.name: Felfire Hawk
416.description: Felfire is deadly to the touch.  Luckily, the hawk can suppress the flames, choosing not to incinerate its rider in an emerald effigy.

417.name: Corrupted Fire Hawk
417.description: Millagazor was a fire hawk loyal to Ragnaros. At this time it is unknown how many of Millagazor's eggs were corrupted.

418.name: Savage Raptor
418.description: One-time companion of Kanga the Primal, the fallen troll hero. The raptor's name is unknown, for Kanga only spoke to it in bear form.

419.name: Amani Battle Bear
419.description: The Amani trolls decorate these ferocious mounts in magic amulets and ceremonial masks as a way to venerate the bear god Nalorakk.

420.name: Subdued Seahorse
420.description: "One has not truly lived until they have felt the tidal current rushing through their hair while atop a majestic seahorse," said no one.  Ever.

421.name: Winged Guardian
421.description: Unearthed recently in an ancient tomb, this mighty winged lion may have once served one of the ancient Tol'vir princes.

422.name: Vicious War Steed
422.description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

423.name: Vicious War Wolf
423.description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

424.name: Vicious Gladiator's Twilight Drake
424.description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

425.name: Flametalon of Alysrazor
425.description: As with their matriarch, Alysrazor, the fury and fervor of these elemental avians are unquenchable.

426.name: Swift Shorestrider
426.description: A rarity amongst the tallstrider breeds of Kalimdor, but easily recognized by its pungent dead seaweed aroma.

428.name: Ruthless Gladiator's Twilight Drake
428.description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

429.name: Swift Forest Strider
429.description: This vibrant breed can only be found in the forests of Darkmoon Island.

430.name: Swift Springstrider
430.description: The joys of Noblegarden are best when celebrated with this loyal, loving, and blandly-colored freak of nature.

431.name: Swift Lovebird
431.description: It's like red but not quite.

432.name: White Riding Camel
432.description: Fennimore Quigley is credited with milking the first camel and breaking the record for "longest unintentional flight," all in the same afternoon.

433.name: Corrupted Hippogryph
433.description: It is a sad fact that even the wise and majestic hippogryph may fall prey to corruption.

434.name: Darkmoon Dancing Bear
434.description: These fearsome mounts have a habit of suddenly breaking out into dance amid battle, much to the annoyance of their riders.

435.name: Mountain Horse
435.description: Images of this breed are often found on kegs of watered-down dwarven brew.

436.name: Swift Mountain Horse
436.description: Longs for the day it may return to its home in Gilneas.

439.name: Tyrael's Charger
439.description: A symbol of justice throughout all known realms.

440.name: Spectral Gryphon
440.description: When you said an old friend was coming back, this was not quite what I expected. -Bralla Cloudwing

441.name: Spectral Wind Rider
441.description: How do you not fall right through that thing? -Maztha

442.name: Blazing Drake
442.description: Blazing Drakes exhibit a boundless passion for life, and are considered by many to be among the most loyal mounts on Azeroth.

443.name: Twilight Harbinger
443.description: Whatever dark magic once compelled the Twilight Harbinger is now broken... or is it?

444.name: Life-Binder's Handmaiden
444.description: Alexstrasza, the former dragon Aspect of Life, is known to be a kind and patient mentor. Under her tutelage, only the most dedicated pupils acquire the title of "Life-Binder's Handmaiden."

445.name: Experiment 12-B
445.description: Some believe Experiment 12-B is the result of a covert SI-7 initiative, others consider it the outcome of embyronic tinkering by goblin scientists. No matter the case, this much is certain: given its strength, speed and agility, Experiment 12-B was a success!

446.name: Heart of the Aspects
446.description: You are Azeroth's true guardians and the future of this world is in your hands, for the dawning of the age of mortals has begun. - Alexstrasza

447.name: Feldrake
447.description: Fighting the Burning Legion millennia ago, this valiant drake fell to corruption after its body was infused with raw demonic magic.

448.name: Jade Cloud Serpent
448.description: Jade Cloud Serpents are light and agile; quick and deadly.

449.name: Azure Water Strider
449.description: "Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle

450.name: Pandaren Kite
450.description: This "mount," awarded by the Lorewalkers of Pandaria, is a reward to the hero of their organization.

451.name: Jeweled Onyx Panther
451.description: Trade Prince Gallywix recently ordered dozens of these glittering jewel-encrusted mounts to roam the grounds of his pleasure palace.

452.name: Green Dragon Turtle
452.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

453.name: Great Red Dragon Turtle
453.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

454.name: Cindermane Charger
454.description: Formed by Ragnaros himself as a gift for the daughter he never had.

455.name: Obsidian Nightwing
455.description: When you can't run, you crawl, and when you can't crawl you find someone to carry you.

456.name: Sapphire Panther
456.description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

457.name: Jade Panther
457.description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

458.name: Ruby Panther
458.description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

459.name: Sunstone Panther
459.description: Legends say that an ancient pandaren emperor crafted the first jeweled panther for his son after the boy's twin brother died of an illness.

460.name: Grand Expedition Yak
460.description: These beasts of burden are known to carry over five times their own weight and to be capable of lasting several days without food or water.

462.name: Kafa Yak
462.description: It's unclear whether grummles named this yak after its color or purpose.

463.name: Amber Scorpion
463.description: The Klaxxi ride massive scorpions into battle against their enemies.  A carapace hardened by amber provides superior protection while on the battlefield.

464.name: Azure Cloud Serpent
464.description: Azure Cloud Serpents are believed by the Pandaren to be harbingers of good fortune.

465.name: Golden Cloud Serpent
465.description: Golden Cloud Serpents are a treasure to be enjoyed by all who visit the continent of Pandaria.

466.name: Thundering Jade Cloud Serpent
466.description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

467.name: Cataclysmic Gladiator's Twilight Drake
467.description: Heroes who proved their might in the gladiatorial arenas during the Cataclysm were awarded the most exceptional of the twilight drake broods.

468.name: Imperial Quilen
468.description: Favorite pets of the ancient Mogu princes, Quilen make loyal and fearless companions and mounts.

469.name: Depleted-Kyparium Rocket
469.description: When Kyparite is depleted of its amber essence it becomes fairly resistant to the corrosion from rocket fuel.

470.name: Geosynchronous World Spinner
470.description: This rocket was originally designed to speed up the rotation of the world making for shorter nights.  Gnomes with insomnia can have lofty goals.

471.name: Onyx Cloud Serpent
471.description: Onyx Cloud serpents are known to be more aggressive and daring than their cousins, the Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents.

472.name: Crimson Cloud Serpent
472.description: Crimson Cloud Serpents are given to flights of fancy, striking out on a whim for seemingly random journeys, sometimes for days at a time.

473.name: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpent
473.description: Heavenly Onyx Cloud Serpents are born with violet scales covering the entirety of their body. Over time, these scales darken to the color of onyx.

474.name: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpent
474.description: Heavenly Crimson Cloud Serpents are considered to be among the noblest of dragons.

475.name: Heavenly Golden Cloud Serpent
475.description: Warmth and hope emanate from this great creature, which glows like a sunrise over the mountains.

476.name: Yu'lei, Daughter of Jade
476.description: Warmth and wisdom emanate from this great creature, which glows like moonlight passing through the finest jade.

477.name: Heavenly Azure Cloud Serpent
477.description: Warmth and serenity emanate from this great creature, which glows like the cloudless sky of a summer afternoon.

478.name: Astral Cloud Serpent
478.description: It is believed that Astral Cloud Serpents possess answers to some of life's greatest mysteries. Pity they can't talk.

479.name: Azure Riding Crane
479.description: The majestic crane is a treasured friend of the pandaren.

480.name: Golden Riding Crane
480.description: The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility, their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous

481.name: Regal Riding Crane
481.description: The crane is a symbol of wisdom and nobility. Their ability to carry us into the skies is nothing short of miraculous. - Jaluu the Generous

482.name: Jungle Riding Crane
482.description: A beloved mount in southern Pandaria, the jungle crane is known for its speed and agility honed over a lifetime of avoiding Krasari tigers.

484.name: Black Riding Yak
484.description: Grummles traveling Kun-Lai Summit by night prefer to ride this dark-haired yak to remain unseen, though they remove the bells from its caparison first.

485.name: Modest Expedition Yak
485.description: Unlike its burden-bearing kin, this yak prefers to travel light and go no more than a mile at a time.

486.name: Grey Riding Yak
486.description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

487.name: Blonde Riding Yak
487.description: Riding Yaks are bred to be slimmer and more agile than their kin.

488.name: Crimson Water Strider
488.description: "Normally bugs are for bait, but how could you look into its eyes and even think that?" -Nat Pagle

492.name: Black Dragon Turtle
492.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

493.name: Blue Dragon Turtle
493.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

494.name: Brown Dragon Turtle
494.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

495.name: Purple Dragon Turtle
495.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

496.name: Red Dragon Turtle
496.description: Cherished for their heavy carrying capacity and steady gait, these stalwart beasts are the mount of choice for most native Pandaren.

497.name: Great Green Dragon Turtle
497.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

498.name: Great Black Dragon Turtle
498.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

499.name: Great Blue Dragon Turtle
499.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

500.name: Great Brown Dragon Turtle
500.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

501.name: Great Purple Dragon Turtle
501.description: "Packaged upgrades include; dual-lantern fog lights, emergency brew keg, and genuine Tanji leather seat."  - Turtlemaster Odai

503.name: Crimson Pandaren Phoenix
503.description: The plumage of the Crimson Phoenix is said to represent prosperity and happiness.

504.name: Thundering August Cloud Serpent
504.description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

505.name: Green Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
505.description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

506.name: Blue Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
506.description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

507.name: Red Shado-Pan Riding Tiger
507.description: "When waking a tiger, use a long stick. Better yet, tell your friend to wake the tiger instead." -Pandaren Proverb

508.name: Brown Riding Goat
508.description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

509.name: Red Flying Cloud
509.description: An ancient mogu artifact awarded to those who are deeply committed to the discovery and sharing of Pandaren lore.

510.name: White Riding Goat
510.description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

511.name: Black Riding Goat
511.description: It takes unflagging patience and a gentle touch to train obstinate mountain goats for riding.

515.name: Son of Galleon
515.description: Trained from a young age, these massive Mushan are taught to thunder into battle carrying a full saurok warband.

516.name: Pandaren Kite
516.description: This token of honor is a gift from the Lorewalkers of Pandaria. Flying manual seemingly not included, however.

517.name: Thundering Ruby Cloud Serpent
517.description: From their infancy, Thundering Cloud Serpents are drawn to storms. They have been known to chase lightning through the blackened, roiling clouds, and to bathe in the pouring rain.

518.name: Ashen Pandaren Phoenix
518.description: Both the name and color of this majestic phoenix are believed to symbolize rebirth.

519.name: Emerald Pandaren Phoenix
519.description: The colors of this rare phoenix's plumage are said to bring great fortune.

520.name: Violet Pandaren Phoenix
520.description: The Violet Phoenix's plumage is said to symbolize a union of opposing forces.

521.name: Jade Pandaren Kite
521.description: The residents of Pandaria salute your enthusiasm for wildlife preservation. They do have concerns about housing 150 animals per visit, though.

522.name: Sky Golem
522.description: A glorious feat of engineering, the sky golem takes traditional shredder technology to a whole new level (and altitude!).

523.name: Swift Windsteed
523.description: One of Pandaria's most elusive creatures, said to bring good fortune to its rider.

526.name: Grand Armored Gryphon
526.description: This noble gryphon is as staunch a battle companion as any member of the Alliance could ask for.

527.name: Grand Armored Wyvern
527.description: This ferocious beast, renowned among wyvern handlers, was one of the first mounts chosen to take part in the Horde's Dominance Offensive.

528.name: Grand Gryphon
528.description: Gryphons' keen eyesight allows them to see over vast distances and warn their riders of any dangers that lie ahead.

529.name: Grand Wyvern
529.description: Wyverns hail from some of the most inhospitable regions of Kalimdor, making them masters of adapting to any environment.

530.name: Armored Skyscreamer
530.description: Only those heroic souls who surmount every challenge the mogu tyrants place before them can proudly fly the skies on a war-prepared skyscreamer.

531.name: Spawn of Horridon
531.description: When you see a hurricane coming, you get out of the way. Horridon would fight the hurricane and win.

532.name: Ghastly Charger
532.description: Not all of Medivh's victims are gone for good.

533.name: Cobalt Primordial Direhorn
533.description: "When ya fight alongside raptors, ya want a mount dey can't eat." -Unknown dinomancer

534.name: Amber Primordial Direhorn
534.description: There is an old Zandalari saying about wild direhorns: "Run!"

535.name: Slate Primordial Direhorn
535.description: The masks aren't to control the direhorn; they are so no one sees your face when it turns on you.

536.name: Jade Primordial Direhorn
536.description: The festive coloring belies deadly intent.

537.name: Bone-White Primal Raptor
537.description: "They are lethal at eight months, very lethal." -Hemet Nesingwary Jr.

538.name: Red Primal Raptor
538.description: Raptors have spread to nearly all of the lands of Azeroth. It is uncertain whether the trolls led them or followed them.

539.name: Black Primal Raptor
539.description: Speed, cunning, and ferocity are the things trolls and raptors admire about each other.

540.name: Green Primal Raptor
540.description: "Raptors are as loyal as they are vicious. If you ain't friend, you are food." -Kijara

541.name: Malevolent Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
541.description: These cloud serpents have scales that... are the color of clouds, actually.

542.name: Thundering Cobalt Cloud Serpent
542.description: This is a descendant of the irascible Nalak. Lightning erupts from its scales and arcs over the saddle. Dare you sit?

543.name: Clutch of Ji-Kun
543.description: Although Ji-Kun feasted on the failed creations of mogu flesh-shapers, her progeny is willing to eat more pedestrian carcasses.

544.name: Armored Bloodwing
544.description: This monstrous, flesh-eating bat is the undisputed ruler of the night skies.

545.name: Golden Primal Direhorn
545.description: Sharp at both ends and crafty in the middle. Leave it to the trolls to think this was a good idea.

546.name: Crimson Primal Direhorn
546.description: Leave it to the blood elves to pick the red one.

547.name: Hearthsteed
547.description: Each step echoes with the rage of your three opponents.

548.name: Armored Red Dragonhawk
548.description: This rare breed of dragonhawk is a mark of honor in the Horde, gifted by the blood elves. It reflects your tireless effort to amass a small army of mounts.

549.name: Armored Blue Dragonhawk
549.description: After you amassed a massive menagerie of 200 mounts, the animal authorities of the Alliance sent you a means to keep them in line (and out of their hair).

550.name: Brawler's Burly Mushan Beast
550.description: For years pandaren believed these creatures to be untamable. Just ask the first pandaren to do so, Henshi "Limp Along" Homebrew.

551.name: Enchanted Fey Dragon
551.description: This majestic creature is Brightwing's older brother. He affirms that she was, in fact, adopted.

552.name: Ironbound Wraithcharger
552.description: Its ethereal spirit is barely contained by its iron shell. The penultimate creation of Salanar the Horseman, these powerful steeds were once thought to have all been destroyed.

554.name: Vicious Kaldorei Warsaber
554.description: The blades adorning this mount's armor are designed to both inspire fear and pre-slice meals for the warsaber.

555.name: Vicious Skeletal Warhorse
555.description: Only rewarded to those who have bested their foes in battle.

557.name: Spawn of Galakras
557.description: This formidable creature's lineage may be traced to Galakras, and yet further to Galakrond, one of the most infamous of all proto-dragons.

558.name: Kor'kron War Wolf
558.description: The Kor'kron use only the mightiest wolves for their mounts, bedecking them in armor that would break the backs of lesser creatures.

559.name: Kor'kron Juggernaut
559.description: The Kor'kron Juggernaut is a weapon of unbridled destruction, born from the mind of Garrosh Hellscream and made real by his engineers.

560.name: Ashhide Mushan Beast
560.description: Some people say that riding an ashhide mushan will result in favorable health and increased prosperity. These people are called "mount vendors."

561.name: Thundering Onyx Cloud Serpent
561.description: This ebony cloud serpent is a lightning-wreathed vision of such rarity as to have driven many mortals to madness.

562.name: Tyrannical Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
562.description: These cloud serpents always look elegant and slim in classic black.

563.name: Grievous Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
563.description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that are a mixture of ruby, gold, and nearly violet.

564.name: Prideful Gladiator's Cloud Serpent
564.description: These brilliantly colored cloud serpents have scales that range from gold to pink. Or we could call it coral.

568.name: Emerald Hippogryph
568.description: These majestic animals come in various colorings, but the emerald variety can only be tamed by the magic of friendship.

571.name: Iron Skyreaver
571.description: Iron Horde beastmasters bred this rylak for war and then girded it for battle in black steel and smoldering flame.

593.name: Warforged Nightmare
593.description: A nightmarish steed of hardened steel and vengeful spirits, this companion will follow you to the depths of the Firelands and back without complaint.

594.name: Grinning Reaver
594.description: The difference between a smile and a grin is the difference between a kiss and tasting.

600.name: Dread Raven
600.description: Filled with the hatred of an ancient god, the dread raven are the Arakkoa's most trusted guardians.

603.name: Creeping Carpet
603.description: Can't fly, but can creep very quickly.

607.name: Gorestrider Gronnling
607.description: Once "befriended", a gronnling will happily carry its rider to their death.

608.name: Witherhide Cliffstomper
608.description: Tiny notches cover the hooves of this variation of clefthoof, allowing it to safely scale mountainous regions in search of food.

609.name: Trained Icehoof
609.description: It wasn't until you owned this mount that you understood how much the world of Draenor would test you. Clefthoof hair gets in everything!

611.name: Tundra Icehoof
611.description: A translucent layer of down hair covers this breed's leathery hide, acting as the perfect insulation for cold environments.

612.name: Bloodhoof Bull
612.description: Members of the Warsong clan have long hunted these clefthoof to use their crimson-hued skin for battle standards.

613.name: Ironhoof Destroyer
613.description: Blackhand is said to have personally designed the fiery armaments used on the Iron Horde's clefthoof battle mounts.

614.name: Mottled Meadowstomper
614.description: The elekk's long trunk allows it to sniff out sources of food, avoid danger, and steal snacks from your bags when you're not looking.

615.name: Trained Meadowstomper
615.description: The draenei perfected elekk husbandry long ago, adorning the creatures with Light-infused crystals to make them more docile.

616.name: Shadowhide Pearltusk
616.description: Some legends say the draenei first befriended the elekk after one of the beasts saved an injured scout from a pack of vicious podlings.

617.name: Dusty Rockhide
617.description: Ever since acquiring this mount, you have been plagued by strange fever dreams of hippety-hoppety clippety-cloppety elekk on parade.

618.name: Armored Irontusk
618.description: It is said an elekk never forgets. No wonder it despises the Iron Horde, considering the torment the orcs put the beast through.

619.name: Blacksteel Battleboar
619.description: Refuses to run unless its head is covered in heavy, spiked metal. It's an ego thing.

620.name: Rocktusk Battleboar
620.description: It's not the metal helmet that attracts mates; it's the sweet mohawk.

621.name: Armored Frostboar
621.description: Subsists almost entirely on a diet of frozen berries. Though it finds slow off-worlders equally tasty.

622.name: Armored Razorback
622.description: Never... ever... EVER... let it smell bacon on you.

623.name: Frostplains Battleboar
623.description: If it didn't have the cool tusk ring, it would feel so silly in that outfit.

624.name: Wild Goretusk
624.description: If you want a gentle ride, go find a "tame happytusk" or something.

625.name: Domesticated Razorback
625.description: "Domesticated" does not mean "friendly." Bring some treats.

626.name: Giant Coldsnout
626.description: Its snout is not just cold but wet. Not a pleasant way to wake up.

627.name: Great Greytusk
627.description: Sheds its tusks once a year. Is extremely shy until they grow back.

628.name: Trained Rocktusk
628.description: Thoroughly trained in how to snort, trot, and stomp on the faces of its enemies.

629.name: Trained Riverwallow
629.description: Riverwallows are one of the heartiest beasts on Draenor, resulting in their increased stamina and distinctive coloring.

630.name: Sapphire Riverbeast
630.description: This animal's color mimics the clear blue of Draenor's river shallows, making it almost invisible to aquatic predators.

631.name: Mudback Riverbeast
631.description: Special webbing that grows on the soles of the mudback's feet gives them extra traction in mud and slick terrain.

632.name: Mosshide Riverwallow
632.description: Aggressive and territorial, the mosshide is known for hiding in river-shore scrub and ambushing unwary passersby.

633.name: Hellfire Infernal
633.description: From the bowels of the nether is summoned a creature of pure hatred, bent on burning down any life in its way.

634.name: Solar Spirehawk
634.description: Looking into the eyes of this mystical beast is like peering into the heart of the sun. Goggles are recommended when you're riding.

635.name: Shadowmane Charger
635.description: Draenei poets have likened this talbuk's coloring to shadows cast by moonlight in an ashen forest.

636.name: Swift Breezestrider
636.description: Draenei have relied on this mount, the swiftest of all talbuk, to relay messengers and their missives safely to their destinations.

637.name: Trained Silverpelt
637.description: Prized for its intelligence, this breed of talbuk can be trained to execute defensive kicks and gorings in battle.

638.name: Breezestrider Stallion
638.description: These breezestriders' red coloration reflects their temperament: sanguine, fierce, and courageous.

639.name: Pale Thorngrazer
639.description: This talbuk subsists completely on a diet of thistles and thorns, making its insides as tough as its outside.

640.name: Vicious War Ram
640.description: Until it head-butts you below the belt, it has not truly accepted you as its rider.

641.name: Vicious War Raptor
641.description: Because sharp teeth and claws weren't enough.

642.name: Garn Steelmaw
642.description: A trainer once tried to put decorative metal in his steelmaw wolf's mouth. He had to wait three days to get it back.

643.name: Warsong Direfang
643.description: Has a will of iron but is a sweetheart if you give it a clefthoof bone to chew on.

644.name: Armored Frostwolf
644.description: It's trained to survive the harsh climate of Frostfire Ridge, so it snuggles as if its life depended on it.

645.name: Ironside Warwolf
645.description: It has an armored spike on its tail. Scratch its belly at your own risk.

646.name: Coldflame Infernal
646.description: The strange icy flames cause you to sweat and shiver at the same time.

647.name: Trained Snarler
647.description: Enormously cute as a puppy. Slightly less so now.

648.name: Swift Frostwolf
648.description: Amidst the cold heights of Frostfire, the frostwolves hunt anything they can catch. The fastest among them eat well.

649.name: Smoky Direwolf
649.description: Believed to reside mostly in the north. Hates weddings.

650.name: Dustmane Direwolf
650.description: Cautious by direwolf standards, the dustmane can only be coaxed to ride with something it considers special.

651.name: Warlord's Deathwheel
651.description: Often referred to as the "Goblin Lawn Mower", this growling behemoth treats enemies like they are made of grass... ready to be mown down.

652.name: Champion's Treadblade
652.description: Forged by human, gnome, and dwarf, this armored masterpiece is designed to slice a tauren into a tri-tip dinner with a flick of the handlebars.

654.name: Challenger's War Yeti
654.description: Thankfully they move fast and mostly leave the smell behind them.

655.name: Sunhide Gronnling
655.description: Loves the sun, hates everything else.

656.name: Llothien Prowler
656.description: These sleek foxes can prowl amongst newly-fallen leaves without making a sound, even at this size.

657.name: Garn Nighthowl
657.description: The garn are the most fierce predators on Draenor, and always hunt in packs.

663.name: Bloodfang Widow
663.description: Its long, serrated limbs drip with the blood of its enemies and/or mate.

664.name: Emerald Drake
664.description: "Is the emerald drake rare?  You have no idea.  If I had a silver for every time someone asked me about one, I could have retired years ago." -Mei Francis

678.name: Chauffeured Mechano-Hog
678.description: Why drive yourself around when you can hire someone to do it for you?

682.name: Voidtalon of the Dark Star
682.description: Corrupted by the presence of the Dark Star in Draenor, the Voidtalons resisted being broken by the Shadowmoon Clan and were ultimately destroyed by Ner'zhul. Only a single egg remains, lost in the void.

741.name: Mystic Runesaber
741.description: Infused with arcane power, the Mystic Runesaber has long been hidden by chaotic nether energies. Recently they have emerged from the shadows in search of ley lines to sate their thirst for magic.

751.name: Felsteel Annihilator
751.description: Forged deep within Hellfire Citadel by a mad blacksmith, the Felsteel Annihilator combines the metalworking knowledge of the Iron Horde with the chaotic fel energies of the Burning Legion into an unholy union of steel and flame.

753.name: Corrupted Dreadwing
753.description: Bathed in the blood of demons, these corrupted Dread Ravens are significantly more aggressive, and will often kill one another if kept in confinement.

756.name: Vicious War Kodo
756.description: The spiked ball on the tail is strong enough to crush through even the most reinforced Alliance defenses.

758.name: Infernal Direwolf
758.description: A mighty wolf of Draenor, touched by the fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan in Tanaan Jungle. It has not gone completely mad... yet.

759.name: Primal Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
759.description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

760.name: Wild Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
760.description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

761.name: Warmongering Gladiator's Felblood Gronnling
761.description: One of the gronnlings of Tanaan Jungle caught in the eruption of fel energies unleashed by Gul'dan, and now beholden to an unquenchable lust for chaos.

762.name: Coalfist Gronnling
762.description: This little gronnling is well-known for smashing his way into garrison inns and making a mess of the pots and pans.

763.name: Illidari Felstalker
763.description: The Illidari have broken some lesser demons for use against their Legion masters.

764.name: Grove Warden
764.description: These magical companions are the wardens of peaceful, primordial groves within the Emerald Dream.

765.name: Bristling Hellboar
765.description: The one and only source for the rare culinary ingredient: cursed bacon.

768.name: Deathtusk Felboar
768.description: Veterans of the battle for Outland's Hellfire Peninsula are traumatized by thoughts of these beasts to this day.

769.name: Minion of Grumpus
769.description: No one quite knows when the legend of Grumpus began in Draenor, but his toys are just the worst.

772.name: Soaring Skyterror
772.description: The extra-light equipment on this chromatic rylak allows it to swoop and glide through the clouds easily, free from the bounds of the land below.

773.name: Grove Defiler
773.description: The Grove Wardens of the Emerald Dream were some of the first to fall to the corrupting influence of the Nightmare.

775.name: Prestigious War Steed
775.description: Armored to withstand collisions in battle.

776.name: Swift Spectral Rylak
776.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

778.name: Eclipse Dragonhawk
778.description: Captured from the renegade blood elves at Eclipse Point, these purple dragonhawks were often sought after by Scryers posted to the Sanctum of the Stars.

779.name: Spirit of Eche'ro
779.description: The spirit of Huln Highmountain's pet moose.

780.name: Felsaber
780.description: A special creation of Lord Illidan gifted to his most trusted demon hunters.

781.name: Infinite Timereaver
781.description: Fickle and savage, these drakes slip in and out of time until they find a worthy rider.

784.name: Prestigious War Wolf
784.description: At Warchief Hellscream's command, Horde trainers began raising wolves to thrive in the shock and ferocity of sustained combat.

791.name: Felblaze Infernal
791.description: The Illidari were able to break one of these fiery beasts for use as an unstoppable, fearless mount against the Legion.

793.name: Predatory Bloodgazer
793.description: The sheer amount of raw red berries these fierce omnivores consume gives them their distinctive eye color.

794.name: Brilliant Direbeak
794.description: The shimmering hides of these deceptively fierce and coordinated beasts are intended to confuse and disorient prey.

795.name: Snowfeather Hunter
795.description: Capable of hiding in a fog bank until prey approaches, then slicing them open with one claw-raised jump.

796.name: Viridian Sharptalon
796.description: Adept at blending into dense, magical forests, such as one may find around the Broken Isles.

797.name: Steelbound Devourer
797.description: Only the sturdiest-forged chains can restrain this beast.

799.name: Flarecore Infernal
799.description: The Legion has conquered thousands of other planets, devising fiendish alterations to their war machines when faced with extreme conditions.

800.name: Brinedeep Bottom-Feeder
800.description: These elusive fish prefer to skulk in the deepest reaches of the Great Sea, searching the darkness for food.

802.name: Long-Forgotten Hippogryph
802.description: You are the only one that remembered.

803.name: Mastercraft Gravewing
803.description: Handcrafted by the Stonewright herself, this mastefully crafted stoneborn is entrusted only to those she deems worthy.

804.name: Ratstallion
804.description: Years of chain-chugging potions in Dalaran's sewer system have allowed him to grow large, agile, and shadow resistant.

826.name: Prestigious Bronze Courser
826.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

831.name: Prestigious Royal Courser
831.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

832.name: Prestigious Forest Courser
832.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

833.name: Prestigious Ivory Courser
833.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

834.name: Prestigious Azure Courser
834.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

836.name: Prestigious Midnight Courser
836.description: One of the bold equines of the Broken Isles, unmatched among the steeds of Azeroth in ferocity and strength.

838.name: Fathom Dweller
838.description: Deep within the hungering chasms of the Great Sea, swarms of Fathom Dwellers sway like a great floating carpet, sightlessly in the dark.

841.name: Vicious Gilnean Warhorse
841.description: Born, bred and battle tested in Gilneas.

842.name: Vicious War Trike
842.description: The most devastating technology money can buy.

844.name: Vicious War Elekk
844.description: A favorite of warriors of the Exodar.

845.name: Mechanized Lumber Extractor
845.description: Jepetto may have over done it a little...

846.name: Leyfeather Hippogryph
846.description: Ancient mounts of the Highborne, now left to run wild in the Broken Isles, they can rarely be found due to their latent magical powers.

847.name: Arcadian War Turtle
847.description: Bred for destruction by an insane warlord in a far-off land, but at least the seat is warm.

848.name: Vindictive Gladiator's Storm Dragon
848.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

849.name: Fearless Gladiator's Storm Dragon
849.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

850.name: Cruel Gladiator's Storm Dragon
850.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

851.name: Ferocious Gladiator's Storm Dragon
851.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

852.name: Fierce Gladiator's Storm Dragon
852.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

853.name: Dominant Gladiator's Storm Dragon
853.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

854.name: Great Northern Elderhorn
854.description: One of the heartiest of species that inhabit the slopes of Highmountain, they can survive for months in freezing blizzards.

855.name: Darkwater Skate
855.description: Little is known about this elusive species of ray, found only in the dark waters surrounding Darkmoon Island.

860.name: Archmage's Prismatic Disc
860.description: Three elements have been fused to create this magical disc, which is attuned to your specific magical powers.

861.name: High Priest's Lightsworn Seeker
861.description: Once plentiful, only three seekers remain on Azeroth after generations of battling the corruption of the cosmos.

864.name: Ban-Lu, Grandmaster's Companion
864.description: The child of Xuen, Ban-Lu has served each Grandmaster faithfully for many years.

865.name: Huntmaster's Loyal Wolfhawk
865.description: The spirit of the Great Hunter found you worthy, and now its children will answer your call forevermore.

866.name: Deathlord's Vilebrood Vanquisher
866.description: A powerful red dragon raised in undeath by its own life energies, a true mockery of life.

868.name: Slayer's Felbroken Shrieker
868.description: You broke it, you bought it.

870.name: Huntmaster's Fierce Wolfhawk
870.description: A jumble of talons and claws that can fly and swim. No one is safe.

872.name: Huntmaster's Dire Wolfhawk
872.description: If asked to fetch, will most likely bring you back the head of a small mammal or humanoid.

873.name: Vicious War Bear
873.description: Almost twice as vicious as its Horde counterpart.

874.name: Vicious War Bear
874.description: Nearly twice as vicious as its Alliance counterpart.

875.name: Midnight
875.description: Still one of the most vicious steeds stabled in Karazhan.

876.name: Vicious War Lion
876.description: Many squires were harmed in the making of this mount.

877.name: Ivory Hawkstrider
877.description:
"My winged children fill the skies. Not this one though."

-Aviana

878.name: Brawler's Burly Basilisk
878.description: The spikes on this beast can pierce plate armor with ease -- only the most elite riders can even consider mounting this deadly pincushion.

881.name: Arcanist's Manasaber
881.description:
Upon her return to The Nighthold, First Arcanist Thalyssra saw to it that adventurers who helped her liberate Suramar were rewarded with prized mounts from the royal stable.

Summoning this mount in Suramar City will also apply Masquerade.

883.name: Smoldering Ember Wyrm
883.description: Arcanagos sought to turn Medivh away from experiments into the arcane, but the influence of Sargeras had corrupted the wizard too deeply, and the great dragon paid for the transgression with eternal, burning agony.

884.name: Shadowblade's Murderous Omen
884.description: The preferred vehicle for assassinations, they make no sounds when flying - really great for sneaking up on people.

885.name: Highlord's Golden Charger
885.description: The fanciest of all of the horses.

891.name: Shadowblade's Crimson Omen
891.description: The blood of your enemies won't even show up, blends right in.

893.name: Highlord's Vigilant Charger
893.description: His blank horse stare is "vigilance," actually.

896.name: Primal Flamesaber
896.description: The primal landscape of Azeroth was once swarming with elemental creatures of all types.

898.name: Netherlord's Chaotic Wrathsteed
898.description: A deadly combination of fel and horse.

899.name: Abyss Worm
899.description: The shadows that trail off of its scales are otherworldly, is this creature from the depths of Azeroth's oceans?

900.name: Vicious War Turtle
900.description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

901.name: Vicious War Turtle
901.description: Now you can literally turtle up in the flag room.

905.name: Leywoven Flying Carpet
905.description: The threads are so thin and well-stitched, you can't imagine it wasn't made by magic, strand by strand.

906.name: Darkspore Mana Ray
906.description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

926.name: Alabaster Hyena
926.description: These hyena are used by the Voldunai to quickly move unseen throughout the sands.

928.name: Dune Scavenger
928.description: These resilient scavengers can survive for months in the wastes of Vol'dun with scarce access to food and water.

930.name: Netherlord's Brimstone Wrathsteed
930.description: The smell isn't particularly pleasant, and it REALLY stays with you.

931.name: Netherlord's Accursed Wrathsteed
931.description: Shadow plus fire, what could go wrong?

932.name: Lightforged Warframe
932.description: The Army of the Light conducts quick, brutal hit-and-run attacks using these agile war machines.

933.name: Obsidian Krolusk
933.description: This krolusk is marked with proof of surviving scores of trials and hardships.

934.name: Swift Spectral Hippogryph
934.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

935.name: Blue Qiraji War Tank
935.description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

936.name: Red Qiraji War Tank
936.description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

937.name: Black Qiraji War Tank
937.description: The Qiraji War Tank has only been seen recently during the Call of the Scarab, could this hint at a resurfacing of the deadly creatures?

939.name: Sable Ruinstrider
939.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

941.name: Highmountain Elderhorn
941.description: The favored mount of Highmountain hunters, they can easily leap across the rushing rivers of Pinerock Basin even when saddled with a full-sized Tauren.

942.name: Wild Dreamrunner
942.description: Dreamrunners flit between this world and the Emerald Dream at will, reveling in their wild nature.

943.name: Cloudwing Hippogryph
943.description: Moreso than normal hippogryphs, the cloudwings of Azsuna prefer to nest high up in mountain caves far above the cloud line.

944.name: Valarjar Stormwing
944.description: The beating of its wings sound like the rolling of thunder in the distance.

947.name: Riddler's Mind-Worm
947.description: It feeds on your thoughts, even the ones you are thinking as you read this.

948.name: Demonic Gladiator's Storm Dragon
948.description: Born in the mountains of Stormheim, this terrifying fusion of storm and scale sets the sky ablaze in pursuit of its prey.

949.name: Luminous Starseeker
949.description: Energetic apex hunters of Argus, the panthara hunt by sensing the energy within living things. A panthara approaching a powerful energy source will visibly change color and become more excited.

954.name: Shackled Ur'zul
954.description: Formed from the tormented bodies and souls of fallen members of the Army of the Light, the Ur'zul is both fascinating and horrifying.

955.name: Vile Fiend
955.description: Infused with acidic blood through a terrifying ritual, you can feel your control over this beast is tenuous at best.

956.name: Leaping Veinseeker
956.description: Bug spray and a hat with netting aren't going to do much in the swamps of Nazmir, bring a club.

958.name: Spectral Pterrorwing
958.description: Vengeful spectres abound in the spirit realm surrounding Dazar'alor.

959.name: Stormwind Skychaser
959.description: "Give me all the engines you got." - Engineer Cogspinner

960.name: Orgrimmar Interceptor
960.description: A forward-mounted wolf's head cannon makes this air superiority fighter especially good at dogfighting.

961.name: Lucid Nightmare
961.description: When riding this mount, your thoughts often wander to far-off places.

962.name: Darkmoon Dirigible
962.description: Silas considered using his fleet of blimps for marketing, but decided that selling them directly was all the marketing he needed.

963.name: Bloodgorged Crawg
963.description: This crawg was left alone to feast on G'huun's corrupted blood and rot. He was so happy.

964.name: Amethyst Ruinstrider
964.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

965.name: Cerulean Ruinstrider
965.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

966.name: Beryl Ruinstrider
966.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

967.name: Umber Ruinstrider
967.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

968.name: Russet Ruinstrider
968.description: Talbuks, native to Argus, have evolved chitinous plates to survive the decades of ceaseless war that ravages the landscape.

970.name: Maddened Chaosrunner
970.description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

971.name: Antoran Charhound
971.description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

972.name: Antoran Gloomhound
972.description: Sargeras' own hound was maybe once a felstalker, but over the years the Dark Titan reforged and reshaped his companion into something much more powerful. When, at last, he was pleased with his creation, he set about creating more of the hounds, and imbuing them with shadow and flame.

973.name: Lambent Mana Ray
973.description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

974.name: Vibrant Mana Ray
974.description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

975.name: Felglow Mana Ray
975.description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

976.name: Scintillating Mana Ray
976.description: Some of the natural wildlife of Argus, like the mana ray, has survived and adapted to life on the shattered world.

978.name: Violet Spellwing
978.description: A gift from the Council of Six for saving Azeroth from the threat of the Legion once more.

979.name: Crimson Slavermaw
979.description: Answers to a series of noises that cannot be made by non-demonic creatures but roughly translates to "Deathslobber."

980.name: Acid Belcher
980.description: Twice as acid-filled as the usual fiend.

981.name: Biletooth Gnasher
981.description: Its bite is definitely worse than its bark-like gurgling sound.

982.name: Pond Nettle
982.description: This miraculous aquatic species can survive in the harshest environments, perhaps even the void of space.

983.name: Glorious Felcrusher
983.description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

984.name: Blessed Felcrusher
984.description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

985.name: Avenging Felcrusher
985.description: After Alleria and Turalyon explained the usefulness of the Draenei's long-time companion animal, the Army of the Light brought several into the fold for training.

986.name: Bleakhoof Ruinstrider
986.description: The Army of the Light could only save so many of Argus' native species; countless numbers were lost to chaos.

993.name: Squawks
993.description: Guess why he's called that? It's not because he's a nice, quiet pet.

994.name: Royal Seafeather
994.description: The sharp beaks of these parrots are capable of breaking open large nuts with ease.

995.name: Sharkbait
995.description: Sharkbait's loyalty lies with whomever keeps the crackers coming.

996.name: Seabraid Stallion
996.description: Horses in the Kul Tiran military are bred from an early age not to fear the sea, and revel in galloping along the shoreline and through the spray.

997.name: Gilded Ravasaur
997.description: A mount fit for Zandalari high priests and councilers, gilded with only the finest decoration and blessed by Rezan, the great devilsaur loa.

999.name: Xiwyllag ATV
999.description: It was said that this invention was modeled after the likeness of a very wealthy goblin. Although others don't really see the resemblance.

1006.name: Lightforged Felcrusher
1006.description: A gift of thanks from the Lightforged draenei, this stalwart elekk is conditioned to charge headlong into darkness without fear.

1007.name: Highmountain Thunderhoof
