1007.description: A gift from the tauren who trained this sure-footed highland moose to safely traverse the paths and peaks of Highmountain.

1008.name: Nightborne Manasaber
1008.description: Born capable of sniffing out concentrations of arcane energy, this noble cat was presented with thanks to a proven ally of the nightborne.

1009.name: Starcursed Voidstrider
1009.description: This shadow-infused strider embodies the elves' commitment to harness the power of the Void in the name of the Alliance.

1010.name: Admiralty Stallion
1010.description: These sleek white stallions are the few mounts allowed to embark on Kul Tiran ships.

1011.name: Shu-Zen, the Divine Sentinel
1011.description: As the Golden Lotus worked tirelessly to repair the Vale of Eternal Blossoms, a single statue came to life and wordlessly defended them from the Sha that assaulted them. Believed by some to be a sign of good fortune and others to be a gift from the Light, Shu-Zen provides faithful companionship to any that would defend Azeroth from the maddening whispers of the Old Gods.

1012.name: Green Marsh Hopper
1012.description: Gottum collects spawns of Krag'wa from all around the Frogmarsh, but only the most bulbous are used as mounts.

1013.name: Honeyback Harvester
1013.description: While most Harvesters dream only of honey and flowers, this adventurous specimen looks to the wide world beyond Stormsong Valley.

1015.name: Dapple Gray
1015.description: A favored mount of the sea priests who call Stormsong home.

1016.name: Smoky Charger
1016.description: Among the oldest horse breeds in Kul Tiras, they even led many a charge in the original struggle with the drust.

1018.name: Terrified Pack Mule
1018.description: This poor mule was around Drustvar when the witches took over. He's seen too much.

1019.name: Goldenmane
1019.description: Lord Stormsong ordered his cronies to steal this horse from the Norwington Estate in Tiragarde, as he was covetous of its luscious golden mane.

1026.name: Vicious War Basilisk
1026.description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

1027.name: Vicious War Basilisk
1027.description: Its breath is worse than its bite.

1028.name: Mecha-Mogul Mk2
1028.description: The Mk2 is an updated design with a focus on comfort and reliability over firepower.

1030.name: Dread Gladiator's Proto-Drake
1030.description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

1031.name: Sinister Gladiator's Proto-Drake
1031.description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

1032.name: Notorious Gladiator's Proto-Drake
1032.description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

1035.name: Corrupted Gladiator's Proto-Drake
1035.description: They say that proto-drakes can smell fear. This iron-bound monster FEEDS off of it.

1038.name: Zandalari Direhorn
1038.description: The Zandalari pride themselves on being the first to raise and train all of the most ferocious lizards on Azeroth.

1039.name: Mighty Caravan Brutosaur
1039.description: Brutosaurs are used by the Zandalari Empire as both weapons of war and enormous, mobile trading posts.

1040.name: Tomb Stalker
1040.description: These fierce beasts are entombed alongside kings so they may carry their masters through the afterlife.

1042.name: Siltwing Albatross
1042.description: One of the rarest of birds seen on the islands of the Great Sea, and a prized possession amongst traders, if they can capture it.

1043.name: Kua'fon
1043.description: Once a little hatchling, raised into a mighty pterrordax by a loving handler. He never did learn to fly.

1044.name: Mag'har Direwolf
1044.description: Native to Draenor, these wolves are preferred by the Mag'har for their ferocity, loyalty, and for something to snuggle on those cool winter nights.

1045.name: Vicious War Clefthoof
1045.description: The Mag'har bred clefthooves not only as sturdy pack animals, but also powerful instruments of war.

1046.name: Darkforge Ram
1046.description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

1047.name: Dawnforge Ram
1047.description: A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.

1048.name: Dark Iron Core Hound
1048.description: You don't get dogs hotter than this.

1049.name: Undercity Plaguebat
1049.description: One of the last of the giant bats to escape Undercity following the siege of Lordaeron.

1050.name: Vicious War Riverbeast
1050.description: Riverbeasts are actually one of the most dangerous animals on Azeroth, despite their appearance.

1051.name: The Dreadwake
1051.description: A ship unlike any other, held aloft by a gift from an unknown kraken-faced god of the deeps.

1053.name: Underrot Crawg
1053.description: The eternal twilight of the Underrot has robbed this crawg of all pigmentation.

1054.name: Teldrassil Hippogryph
1054.description: One of the last of the great armored hippogryphs to escape the burning of Teldrassil, it carried the last few citizens it could to safety before collapsing of exhaustion.

1057.name: Nazjatar Blood Serpent
1057.description: Monstrous serpents riddled with corruption serve as mounts for N'zoth's high-ranking lieutenants in the Great Sea.

1058.name: Cobalt Pterrordax
1058.description: These pterrordax keep vigil for enemy fleets soaring above the coasts of Zandalar.

1059.name: Captured Swampstalker
1059.description: A swamp-dwelling subspecies of pterrordax known to feast on young bloodfeasters.

1060.name: Voldunai Dunescraper
1060.description: These brightly-colored fliers are rarely captured in the wild due to their naturally untrusting natures.

1061.name: Expedition Bloodswarmer
1061.description: Orphaned during the rout of the Blood Trolls, this bloodswarmer has been retrained by Talanji's handlers.

1062.name: Dusky Waycrest Gryphon
1062.description: Common to the dark forests of Drustvar, these gryphon are silent and swift. Their prowess at operating on their own or as mounts lends them to be used for ambush and shock tactics.

1063.name: Stormsong Coastwatcher
1063.description: Tasked with keeping watch on the seas for approaching dangers, the Stormsong Coastwatchers fly constant patrols.

1064.name: Proudmoore Sea Scout
1064.description: Only a few gryphons are selected to be Sea Scouts operating from flag ships in the fleet. Their long range reconnaissance is an integral part of Kul Tiran sea dominance.

1166.name: Great Sea Ray
1166.description: The rays of the great sea can travel for many miles in great migratory patterns.

1167.name: Frostshard Infernal
1167.description: These icy minions come from an unknown plane far from this one.

1168.name: Fiery Hearthsteed
1168.description: These flying creatures thunder unseen across the heavens. How fortunate that this one has shown itself to you!

1169.name: Surf Jelly
1169.description: The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.

1172.name: Conqueror's Scythemaw
1172.description: The battle-hardened shell of this mighty beast can turn aside even the most hefty hammer or sharpened spear.

1173.name: Broken Highland Mustang
1173.description: One of the Arathi horses, taken and broken by the Horde conquerors of Stromgarde.

1174.name: Highland Mustang
1174.description: A valiant steed on the Arathi Highlands, it knows no fear.

1175.name: Twilight Avenger
1175.description: Little is known about the fate of the twilight dragonflight, though they seem to exist in numbers in Grim Batol to this day.

1176.name: Craghorn Chasm-Leaper
1176.description: These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.

1178.name: Qinsho's Eternal Hound
1178.description: Qinsho wrought his eternal guardian from pure gold and imbued it with the resilience of the earth.

1179.name: Palehide Direhorn
1179.description: Pale-skinned direhorns are quite rare, justifying the expense.

1180.name: Swift Albino Raptor
1180.description: The Witherbark warrior Beastrider Kama once cut bloody swathes of terror across the Arathi Highlands astride such a monster.

1182.name: Lil' Donkey
1182.description: Likely stolen from Newstead in the Arathi Highlands, this stalwart little donkey was destined to be eaten by kobolds.

1185.name: Witherbark Direwing
1185.description: Only a handful of these giant bats remain in the Arathi Highlands, carefully raised by the Witherbark forest trolls who first brought them here.

1190.name: Pureheart Courser
1190.description: These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.

1191.name: Frenzied Feltalon
1191.description: The Legion experimented with the corruption of many different types of wildlife, such as this fiery bird species from a molten world.

1192.name: Prestigious Bloodforged Courser
1192.description: Forged in a fiery hatred, the offspring of a nightmare and a dream, this steed feeds on grains grown with the tears of your enemies.

1193.name: Meat Wagon
1193.description: A favorite unit of the Lich King, both for its power as a siege weapon, and the satisfying sound of flung meat.

1194.name: Vicious White Warsaber
1194.description: If you try to give it a belly scratch, you're asking for trouble.

1195.name: Vicious Black Warsaber
1195.description: The only thing these big cats bring home as gifts are the severed limbs of your enemies.

1196.name: Vicious Black Bonesteed
1196.description: These skeletal steeds know no fear, eat no grains, and can travel impossible distances.

1197.name: Vicious White Bonesteed
1197.description: There are few other ways to ride in to battle that feature as many spikes and bones.

1198.name: Kul Tiran Charger
1198.description: The Kul Tiran military prides itself on mastery of both sea, through a vast navy, and land, with armed cavalry.

1199.name: Blackpaw
1199.description: Blackpaw was just hibernating, minding his own business, and then suddenly there was a warfront.

1200.name: Ashenvale Chimaera
1200.description: Ashenvale chimaeras were used frequently by the Kaldorei to decimate structures in battles against the humans, orcs, and undead.

1201.name: Frightened Kodo
1201.description: Nothing frightens a kodo like seeing a bear with antlers.

1203.name: Umber Nightsaber
1203.description: Nightsabers are an integral part of the Kaldorei's army, serving as both mount and assault weapon in one.

1204.name: Sandy Nightsaber
1204.description: A rare color for a nightsaber, and rarely seen, they are prized amongst huntresses.

1205.name: Kaldorei Nightsaber
1205.description: The connection between a nightsaber and its hunter or huntress is nearly inseparable.

1206.name: Blue Marsh Hopper
1206.description: That squishing sound every time it takes a step? That's a feature.

1207.name: Yellow Marsh Hopper
1207.description: No one makes giant, slimy spawns like Krag'wa the Huge.

1208.name: Saltwater Seahorse
1208.description: These giant seahorses are naturally curious, and are often found exploring sunken ship wreckage for shiny things.

1209.name: Stonehide Elderhorn
1209.description: Stonehide elderhorns, one of the few types of moose to inhabit island climates, have thinner fur than most elderhorns.

1210.name: Bloodthirsty Dreadwing
1210.description: The forsaken prefer the use of these bloodthirsty hunters, both for their speed as a mount, and the psychological effect they have on their enemies.

1211.name: Bloodgorged Hunter
1211.description: If he wasn't so full, you wouldn't have caught him.

1212.name: Island Thunderscale
1212.description: One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.

1213.name: Risen Mare
1213.description: Something terrible happened in the lost town of Havenswood.

1214.name: Azureshell Krolusk
1214.description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

1215.name: Rubyshell Krolusk
1215.description: Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.

1216.name: Priestess' Moonsaber
1216.description: Once these elegant cats were only given to high-ranking priestesses of Elune, but now they ride into battle with all manner of champion, in the service of vengeance.

1217.name: G.M.O.D.
1217.description: Garishly sporting extreme amounts of goblin flair, Gallywix commissioned his Mech of Death to one up Mekkatorque in combat and more importantly in style.

1218.name: Dazar'alor Windreaver
1218.description: Soaring high above the Battle of Dazar'alor, these beasts are drawn to the most cunning of victors.

1219.name: Glacial Tidestorm
1219.description: Though she commands a variety of magical powers, Jaina has always been most proficient at summoning powerful elementals of water and ice.

1221.name: Hogrus, Swine of Good Fortune
1221.description: Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

1222.name: Vulpine Familiar
1222.description: A fiercely intelligent and curious species, these fox-like creatures have travelled the Great Dark Beyond and found their way to Azeroth. Drawn to Azeroth's champions, they seek adventure and companionship.

1223.name: Sylverian Dreamer
1223.description: An artist in the magical city of Dalaran fell asleep on her brush, and dreamed of painting a beautiful feathered dragon. Her artwork leapt from the page, and when she awoke, she found it sleeping gently beside her.

1224.name: Wonderwing 2.0
1224.description: Don't ask what happened to the first one -- Mechagon technology is still gnome technology!

1225.name: Crusader's Direhorn
1225.description: A loyal steed to the holy crusaders of Zandalar.

1227.name: Aerial Unit R-21/X
1227.description: King Mechagon's private aerial unit, complete with deployable blast cannon and foot warmers.

1229.name: Rusty Mechanocrawler
1229.description: The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.

1230.name: Unshackled Waveray
1230.description: The Unshackled have a natural kinship with the species of the deep seas that have seen cruelty at the hands of the naga.

1231.name: Ankoan Waveray
1231.description: The Ankoan have been battling the naga for years, and with a natural affinity for the sea, training the local wildlife was a natural strategy.

1232.name: Azshari Bloatray
1232.description: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.

1237.name: Royal Snapdragon
1237.description: Captured at a young age and raised to serve naga hunters, snapdragons are loyal and fierce companions.

1238.name: Snapback Scuttler
1238.description: Giant crabs are native to Nazjatar and a favored food of the naga. This one must have been well-kept to grow this large.

1239.name: X-995 Mechanocat
1239.description: The X-995 is the ultimate in customizeable feline robo-companionship.

1240.name: Obsidian Worldbreaker
1240.description: "I have had many names throughout history, all of them spoken with dread: Neltharion, Xaxas, and many more. Yet you shall know me best as Deathwing, for so I am! I am the bane of life, the darkness within history, the lord of death, the master of destruction. And I tell you now, and so it is true, that this world is mine!" - Neltharion, the Earth-Warder

1242.name: Beastlord's Irontusk
1242.description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.

1243.name: Beastlord's Warwolf
1243.description: One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.

1245.name: Bloodflank Charger
1245.description: Stolen from the Arathi Basin stables, this fire-hearted charger now steeds for the Horde.

1246.name: Ironclad Frostclaw
1246.description: Captured in the snows of Alterac Valley, this bloodthirsty hunter now roars for the Alliance.

1247.name: Mechacycle Model W
1247.description: The rapid technological evolution of the descendants of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.

1248.name: Junkheap Drifter
1248.description: When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.

1249.name: Child of Torcali
1249.description: This daughter of the great direhorn loa, Torcali, never lost faith that her keeper would help her grow to her full potential.

1250.name: Mollie
1250.description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

1252.name: Mechagon Peacekeeper
1252.description: Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.

1253.name: Scrapforged Mechaspider
1253.description: You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.

1254.name: Rustbolt Resistor
1254.description: "R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.

1255.name: Deepcoral Snapdragon
1255.description: The snapdragon is a quiet hunter in the water, but is far less stealthy on land.

1256.name: Snapdragon Kelpstalker
1256.description: When a snapdragon bites you, the worry isn't about the bite itself, but the poison that will begin to eat away at the wound.

1257.name: Silent Glider
1257.description: Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.

1258.name: Fabious
1258.description: He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.

1259.name: Silver Tidestallion
1259.description: This tidestallion and its silvery scales were drawn to the glint of plunder in your pocket.

1260.name: Crimson Tidestallion
1260.description: The blood-red coloration of these creatures is ideal for hiding in large coral formations.

1262.name: Inkscale Deepseeker
1262.description: Schools of tidestallions will viciously slam their muscular chests into their prey to take them down.

1265.name: Uncorrupted Voidwing
1265.description: This spawn of Vexiona, cleansed by Wrathion, comes from a flight with a fractured past and uncertain future.

1266.name: Alabaster Stormtalon
1266.description: Chiseled by the stonemasons of Stormwind, this stone gryphon symbolizes the unbending courage of the Alliance.

1267.name: Alabaster Thunderwing
1267.description: Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.

1269.name: Swift Spectral Fathom Ray
1269.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

1270.name: Swift Spectral Magnetocraft
1270.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

1271.name: Swift Spectral Armored Gryphon
1271.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

1272.name: Swift Spectral Pterrordax
1272.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

1277.name: Honeyback Hivemother
1277.description: Destined to become queen of her hive, she scouts Kul Tiras and Zandalar in search of a suitable home for a new colony to flourish.

1282.name: Black Serpent of N'Zoth
1282.description: The black serpents of N'Zoth are the harbingers of his ultimate vision becoming reality. Only those servants or enemies that can tread this space have any chance of wrangling them.

1283.name: Mechagon Mechanostrider
1283.description: The best mount, logically, serves multiple purposes -- sometimes you need to get places AND reach something high up once you get there.

1285.name: Frostwolf Snarler
1285.description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan, trained to bite dwarves.

1286.name: Caravan Hyena
1286.description: The canopy atop this dune-wanderer can be stored at your campsite, should you desire to feel the wind in your fur.

1287.name: Explorer's Jungle Hopper
1287.description: For when you're making a crash landing in the middle of an uncharted swamp because it's the only way to access that ancient temple.

1288.name: Explorer's Dunetrekker
1288.description: The surly dunetrekker can easily carry a set of explorers to the nearest ruins and back without the need to rest.

1289.name: Ensorcelled Everwyrm
1289.description: Anima is a fundamental force that infuses the Shadowlands. It flows through many creatures, but is also traded, bartered for, and fought over.

1290.name: Squeakers, the Trickster
1290.description: The locals in Halfhill swear that whenever a batch of grain is missing, a farmworking instrument is misplaced, or a bushel of berries can't be found, you can hear a mischievous squeaking, and are reminded to slow down and accept what life gives you.

1291.name: Lucky Yun
1291.description: The Pandaren believe that merely rubbing one's hands on the shiny hide of the ox will grant prosperity, the challenge is catching it.

1292.name: Stormpike Battle Ram
1292.description: Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Stormpike Clan, trained to headbutt orcs.

1293.name: Ny'alotha Allseer
1293.description: To find him, drown yourself in the Circle of Stars.

1297.name: Clutch of Ha-Li
1297.description: The brood of Ha-Li are comfortable in the blue skies of Pandaria, hunting unsuspecting prey.

1298.name: Hopecrusher Gargon
1298.description: Once the loyal mount of a House Briarbane lord, it turned on the lord and his retinue. Members of House Briarbane now whisper of a dark Gargon lying in wait even baiting venthyr who venture through the darker parts of the Chalice District of Revendreth.

1299.name: Battle Gargon Vrednic
1299.description: Prince Renathal's loyal gargon, Vrednic has been by his side for millennia. Adorned in his Sinvyr armor, Vrednic's mere presence instills terror to all those who lay eyes on him as he ushers his rider into battle.

1302.name: Dreamlight Runestag
1302.description: Runestags are granted to those who have pledged their service to the Winter Queen and the Court of Night.

1303.name: Enchanted Dreamlight Runestag
1303.description: The majestic runestags are capable of siphoning anima from the ambient light of Ardenweald with their elaborate antlers. The anima is used as nourishment and to power the runestag's speed and magic.

1304.name: Mawsworn Soulhunter
1304.description: Soulhunters are used to track wayward souls across the wastes that flee from their dark fates, and are one of the only creatures that feel comfortable traversing the maw.

1305.name: Darkwarren Hardshell
1305.description: The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conveniently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.

1306.name: Swift Gloomhoof
1306.description: The ballads of Ardenweald claim that the birth of gloomrunner heralds the passing of a particularly benevolent wild god. Seeing a gloomrunner is therefore a blessing and a curse.

1307.name: Sundancer
1307.description: This sun-dappled courser gallops on lightbeams with carefree abandon.

1309.name: Chittering Animite
1309.description: These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.

1310.name: Horrid Dredwing
1310.description: Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

1311.name: Ivory Cloud Serpent
1311.description: Ivory Cloud Serpents are often mistaken for roaring thunder as they tear through the skies with blistering speed.

1312.name: Gargantuan Grrloc
1312.description: It's the biggest murloc you've ever seen!

1313.name: Rajani Warserpent
1313.description: Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.

1314.name: Drake of the Four Winds
1314.description: Rocks erode, fires sputter, but wind remains powerful regardless of the passage of time. -Phaoris

1315.name: Mail Muncher
1315.description: Worming its way through the Postmaster's network, this serpent of N'Zoth deprived Azeroth of its primary magical correspondence.

1317.name: Waste Marauder
1317.description: Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.

1318.name: Wastewander Skyterror
1318.description: Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.

1319.name: Malevolent Drone
1319.description: The Aqir drones feast on heroes and cowards alike to grow their ranks.

1320.name: Shadowbarb Drone
1320.description: Void, jelly, and a very full belly is all this drone needs.

1321.name: Wicked Swarmer
1321.description: When the Void reached out, the Aqir were formed in its terrible image.

1322.name: Wriggling Parasite
1322.description: It's so wiggly! Just looking at it move is chaotic and unnerving.

1324.name: Elusive Quickhoof
1324.description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

1326.name: Awakened Mindborer
1326.description: It may look menacing right now, but it's actually kind of cute when it's asleep.

1327.name: Ren's Stalwart Hound
1327.description: Houndlord Ren used his strongest quilen to carry him across Pandaria to subjugate the Vale for the Mogu empire.

1328.name: Xinlao
1328.description: The only thing stronger than a quilen's loyalty is its fierce devotion to making sure it covers its owner in kisses.

1329.name: Springfur Alpaca
1329.description: The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

1330.name: Sunwarmed Furline
1330.description: The presence of the giant felines heralds the beginning of the end for the birds of Azeroth.

1332.name: Silky Shimmermoth
1332.description: The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

1346.name: Steamscale Incinerator
1346.description: A mad gnomish inventor had a dream to ride a dragon, so he created this metal monstrosity. He powered it with a trapped demon, in order to create "an authentic dragon soul," and did not survive its activation.

1350.name: Colossal Slaughterclaw
1350.description: Only the most stalwart stable masters of Maldraxxus are able to break the will of the colossal slaughterclaws, giving all champions of the Undying Army a fearsome ally in the Shadowlands.

1351.name: Vicious War Spider
1351.description: When being a courageous member of the Alliance doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

1352.name: Vicious War Spider
1352.description: When being a bellowing member of the Horde doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

1354.name: Shadeleaf Runestag
1354.description: The shadeleaf runestag are bred for their ferocity as well as their beauty by the Wild Hunt. They feel no fear charging into the den of any predator.

1355.name: Wakener's Runestag
1355.description: Runestags enjoy lying near wildseeds. The Wakeners believe they can hear the sleepers' dreams. These runestags display a range of emotions in their vigil, signaling the dreams or nightmares of the spirits within.

1356.name: Winterborn Runestag
1356.description: Winterborn runestags are blessed by the Winter Queen herself. Their runes flare brilliantly when predators are nearby, warning the entire herd.

1357.name: Enchanted Shadeleaf Runestag
1357.description: A shadeleaf runestag is capable of goring creatures as powerful as a gorm matriarch in defense of its herd. The Wild Hunt ride these mounts into dangerous corners of the Shadowlands, when their domain must be defended from those who would threaten the wilds.

1358.name: Enchanted Wakener's Runestag
1358.description: Wakener runestags fiercely protect their wildseed groves. When the groves starting to fail, many runestags went berserk.

1359.name: Enchanted Winterborn Runestag
1359.description: Winterborn runestags are the favored mount of the Winter Queen herself, and she only bestows such a creature on her most favored subjects.

1360.name: Shimmermist Runner
1360.description: Mischievous spriggans and the valerunners have a natural enmity. No valerunner would deign to allow a spriggan rider because they can sense their inherent malevolence. This angers the trickster spriggans who take twisted enjoyment in playing cruel pranks on these majestic creatures.

1361.name: Duskflutter Ardenmoth
1361.description: These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.

1362.name: Spinemaw Gladechewer
1362.description: Spriggan riders tie bits of anima-less detritus to the end of sticks in front of their gorm mounts to steer. It's... an imperfect art.

1363.name: Sinful Gladiator's Soul Eater
1363.description: This mount shows a proclivity for snacking upon the souls cast out of Revendreth.

1364.name: War-Bred Tauralus
1364.description: The soldiers of Maldraxxus protect the Shadowlands, and require a mount that is both capable and calm when faced with overwhelming odds.

1365.name: Plaguerot Tauralus
1365.description: The tauralus is considered courageous, though scholars of Maldraxxus have long wondered if their lack of fear is simply due to the tiny size of their brains.

1366.name: Bonehoof Tauralus
1366.description: There are quite a few reasons that you do not want to stand behind a tauralus, the hooves and whip-like tails being the least of them.

1367.name: Chosen Tauralus
1367.description: Even an unarmored tauralus is a valuable ally in battle, its enormous horns capable of piercing even plate armor.

1368.name: Armored War-Bred Tauralus
1368.description: The tauralus that serve the armies of Maldraxxus have had all traits of compassion bred out of them, and are only adorned in armor when they show that no sword or spell can stop them from carrying their rider to victory.

1369.name: Armored Plaguerot Tauralus
1369.description: When fully armored, a tauralus can take an incredible amount of damage before falling, making it a valuable ally in battle.

1370.name: Armored Bonehoof Tauralus
1370.description: A favored mount of the House of the Chosen, the tauralus only gets more angry and vicious when exposed to battle.

1371.name: Armored Chosen Tauralus
1371.description: The tauralus has two tails, which are both absolutely necessary for whipping away buzzing pests like the bloodlouse.

1372.name: Blisterback Bloodtusk
1372.description: The House of the Chosen train their mounts in all manner of difficult circumstances, so that no matter the battle, they will never falter.

1373.name: Gorespine
1373.description: Nerissa trampled over countless bodies on the back of Gorespine as she rose to prominence as the commander of the Lichsworn forces for the House of Rituals.

1375.name: Lurid Bloodtusk
1375.description: Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

1376.name: Silvertip Dredwing
1376.description: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.

1377.name: Rampart Screecher
1377.description: Roosting among the ramparts of Castle Nathria, these giant dredbats act as sentinels and are trained to take down threats approaching the castle from the air.

1378.name: Harvester's Dredwing
1378.description: The dredwings of the Harvesters fear no mawsworn, and will gleefully sink their teeth into anything that threatens Sinfall.

1379.name: Endmire Flyer
1379.description: Attracted through portals through which little is known these flying devourers have found a home in the Endmire of Revendreth feeding on the latent anima.

1382.name: Inquisition Gargon
1382.description: The gargon of the Inquisitors are some of the most vicious ever carved. The Avowed seek to recapture these beasts and return them to the righteous duty of assisting in the purifying of souls rather than the perversions performed at the hands of the Inquisitors.

1384.name: Sinfall Gargon
1384.description: The gargon are the loyal mounts and companions of the Venthyr and Renathal has found many abandoned at Sinfall, awaiting reawakening and assignment to worthy members of the covenant.

1385.name: Crypt Gargon
1385.description: Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

1387.name: Desire's Battle Gargon
1387.description: The Countess maintains a small stable of elegantly adorned gargon mounts for her sole use. Many a rival has been taken in by the finery to their peril as she personally oversees their deadly training.

1388.name: Gravestone Battle Gargon
1388.description: Representative of a new loyal batch of gargon, these battle ready beasts will take Renathal's most loyal compatriots into the final battles against the Jailer.

1389.name: Battle Gargon Silessa
1389.description: Silessa fought valiantly alongside her master in the great incursion by the Light, following the battle her master set her to guard over a vault room of great value.

1391.name: Loyal Gorger
1391.description: Crawling forth from the cracks between the realms, the devourers have a voracious appetite for anima. Little is known of their origins, but all denizens of the Shadowlands see their recent boldness as a sign of the end times.

1392.name: Pale Acidmaw
1392.description: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.

1393.name: Wild Glimmerfur Prowler
1393.description: This prowler's brilliant green coat distinguishes it from the blues and purples of Ardenweald, making it much easier for others of its kind to see through the midnight woods.

1394.name: Phalynx of Loyalty
1394.description: Some within the Ascended keep a phalynx as a pet. While they may not be as furry as a larion, they are much less likely to eat your other pets.

1395.name: Phalynx of Humility
1395.description: The phalynx does not fetch, though it is not known why this is.

1396.name: Phalynx of Courage
1396.description: A phalynx is considered both a worthy companion and a lithe opponent to test one's reflexes against.

1397.name: Wildseed Cradle
1397.description: The most precious cargo in all Ardenweald, the wildseeds, are cradled by this lovingly-crafted cart. It is imbued with anima to allow it to hover over the ground.

1398.name: Phalynx of Purity
1398.description: Little is known about the origination of phalynx technology, the machinations of which are taught more akin to religion than engineering.

1399.name: Eternal Phalynx of Purity
1399.description: The armored phalynx is a favorite companion of the mightiest warriors of the Ascended as it is both fearless and vicious in battle.

1400.name: Eternal Phalynx of Courage
1400.description: Many bars of gildenite are required to forge one of these sparkling mounts, but the sight of them alone is worth the gathering time.

1401.name: Eternal Phalynx of Loyalty
1401.description: A marvel of steward engineering, the armored phalynx is a rare and awe-inspiring sight.

1402.name: Eternal Phalynx of Humility
1402.description: When an armored phalynx is forged, stewards clap their hammers together in reverence of the skill required in its creation.

1404.name: Silverwind Larion
1404.description: This gift of the silvery winds is only bestowed upon those that search high and low for the wisdom of Bastion.

1405.name: Restoration Deathwalker
1405.description: With the death of the Jailer and the ascension of a new Arbiter, the Shadowlands is returning to its great Purpose. Some deathwalkers recognize the role that mortal heroes have played, and are willing to serve as mounts.

1406.name: Marrowfang
1406.description: Marrowfang, Bonefang's progeny, was respected by Amarth the Harvester for her insatiable appetite, even if it disrupted any experiments that the sadistic commander wanted to run.

1407.name: Callow Flayedwing
1407.description: Flayedwings are a necessary force in the cycle of life for the Shadowlands, acting as both prey and predator for the harsh environment of Maldraxxus.

1408.name: Gruesome Flayedwing
1408.description: The flayedwings of Maldraxxus are prized for their ability to soar effortlessly through the skies of the Shadowlands, allowing their rider a surprise opportunity to strike at their foes or support their allies.

1409.name: Bonesewn Fleshroc
1409.description: Only expert flesh-stitchers who have demonstrated mastery over the magics of Maldraxxus are powerful enough to construct a deathroc of this size.

1410.name: Hulking Deathroc
1410.description: Deathrocs are stitched monstrosities from the discarded viscera, bone, and organs that were not required to construct soldiers for the House of Constructs.

1411.name: Predatory Plagueroc
1411.description: Gieger's everlasting hunger is legendary amongst the House of Constructs, and no beast is too large or bony to fit inside its massive stomach.

1413.name: Dauntless Duskrunner
1413.description: The Path of Ascension is a challenging trial, and those that display all of the facets the Kyrian hold dear will be duly rewarded.

1414.name: Sinrunner Blanchy
1414.description: In life, Blanchy appeared to be an affectionate, well-behaved horse of excellent disposition and appetite. What evils must she have committed in secret to have earned her place among the condemned souls of Revendreth?

1415.name: Arboreal Gulper
1415.description: The wood and foliage growing atop this toad is a natural part of its body, helping it siphon anima from the air to nourish itself.

1416.name: Mawsworn Charger
1416.description: The fate of all horse mounts.

1417.name: Hand of Hrestimorak
1417.description: The treachery of Hrestimorak was infamous, betraying his people to claim power. Facing damnation in the Maw, he tried to subvert the Jailer... a foolish act that would earn him an eternity of torment.

1419.name: Sintouched Deathwalker
1419.description: Forged from the sins of countless diabolical dungeon denizens. Only those with the skills to overcome them may hold its reins.

1420.name: Umbral Scythehorn
1420.description: Umbral gorm are the most docile of all gorm, but they also grow the largest horns and mandibles. They are probably so docile because other creatures avoid riling them.

1421.name: Court Sinrunner
1421.description: Sinrunners were once the steeds of dark souls, carried in the wake of either their sins or their masters' sins to Revendreth. While some chose to run free, many continue to serve darkness in death as they did in life.

1422.name: Warstitched Darkhound
1422.description: These warhounds are crafted by the House of Constructs to carry any rider into the thick of battle, rending and tearing enemy mounts all the while.

1423.name: Highwind Darkmane
1423.description: The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.

1424.name: Snowstorm
1424.description: He comes from the ice and snow, under the Azeroth sun where adventurers go.

1425.name: Gilded Prowler
1425.description: The mighty larion is an apex predator of Bastion, but that does not stop it from enjoying a nice nap in the sunny fields.

1426.name: Ascended Skymane
1426.description: Only those that have proven themselves against the combined might of the Ascended will be able to ride this mount.

1428.name: Amber Ardenmoth
1428.description: The brilliant orange hue of the amber ardenmoth signals to predators that it is dangerous to eat. Consuming one of these creatures will put a predator into a dreamless sleep for years.

1429.name: Vibrant Flutterwing
1429.description: These minty green moths are very friendly. They particularly enjoy having their head fuzz vigorously brushed. They also enjoy music and poetry.

1430.name: Desertwing Hunter
1430.description: In service of the great Purpose, desertwing hunters were designed to fill distant skies of forgotten realms of the Shadowlands.

1431.name: Pale Regal Cervid
1431.description: Looking at these majestic creatures, it's not difficult to see how the idea of cervids developed into the stags found on Azeroth and other mortal worlds.

1433.name: Vespoid Flutterer
1433.description: A flutterer is an overgrown vespoid worker created to carry a rider. Rather than looking to a queen for leadership, it looks to its rider to guide it in all things.

1434.name: Deepstar Aurelid
1434.description: As one of the last remaining polyps of an elusive creature, this aurelid is at home in the water as much as the air.

1436.name: Battle-Hardened Aquilon
1436.description: The aquilon can be a valuable ally in combat, with capabilities exceeding those of the phalynx.

1437.name: Battle-Bound Warhound
1437.description: Warhounds find comfort in conflict, and the Contest of Conquest is the perfect place to find these beasts honing their abilities.

1438.name: Bulbous Necroray
1438.description: The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.

1439.name: Infested Necroray
1439.description: Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.

1440.name: Pestilent Necroray
1440.description: When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.

1441.name: Bound Shadehound
1441.description: Created by deciphering and performing powerful runic magic, this Shadehound is bound to its creator.

1442.name: Corridor Creeper
1442.description: The loyal hounds of the Jailer creep along the corridors in search of the scent of souls.

1443.name: Voracious Gorger
1443.description: The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.

1444.name: Viridian Phase-Hunter
1444.description: Hailing from a species already adept at natural camouflage, the otherworldly energies that transformed Draenor into Outland gave these creatures the ability to shift through space.

1445.name: Slime Serpent
1445.description: This mysterious creature lurks beneath the slime pools of Plaguefall. No one knows where it came from.

1446.name: Tazavesh Gearglider
1446.description: Brokers of all types use these gliders to travel around Tazavesh and similar nearby outposts, and carry their goods as well.

1448.name: Serenade
1448.description: These beautiful helicids emerge only at night. When they are pleased, their shells hum with a joyful melody.

1449.name: Lord of the Corpseflies
1449.description: To be the Lord of the Corpseflies, you've got to lay a LOT of eggs.

1450.name: Soaring Razorwing
1450.description: The hide of the razorwing is light, allowing it to fly, but also quite tough, allowing them to survive passage into the Maw.

1451.name: Vicious War Croaker
1451.description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

1452.name: Vicious War Croaker
1452.description: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

1454.name: Tamed Mauler
1454.description: When it comes to taming devourers, all it takes is a little anima and a lot of patience. And a lot of healing potions.

1455.name: Beryl Shardhide
1455.description: These shardhides find it easy to hide in the underbrush, and it is rare to find one that is tamed.

1456.name: Sapphire Skyblazer
1456.description: These brilliant blue birds burn brighter (and hotter) than their orange cousins, though the origin of both remains a mystery.

1458.name: Wandering Ancient
1458.description: A staunch defender of the forests of Azeroth, the ancients are also known for their glorious canopies of leaves, which change color with the seasons.

1459.name: Vicious War Gorm
1459.description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

1460.name: Vicious War Gorm
1460.description: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

1465.name: Vicious Warstalker
1465.description: Trample the Horde to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Alliance!

1466.name: Vicious Warstalker
1466.description: Trample the Alliance to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Horde!

1467.name: Noble Bruffalon
1467.description: It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.

1468.name: Amber Skitterfly
1468.description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers to the Trading Post, amber skitterflies are remarkably docile.

1469.name: Magmashell
1469.description: Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

1471.name: Vengeance
1471.description: Sylvanas lost a part of herself the day Arthas took her life, and the darkness within her grew to fill the void.

1474.name: Bestowed Thunderspine Packleader
1474.description: A gift from Merithra, who blessed these thunderspines to ensure that no matter where the Maruuk clans roam, they will always be under the green dragonflight's protection.

1475.name: Hand of Bahmethra
1475.description: The most wicked and cruel of her kin, Bahmethra endured the full measure of the Banished One's punishments before her fall.

1476.name: Wild Hunt Legsplitter
1476.description: Integrated into the depleted forces of the Wild Hunt, the fawn riders quickly found that the gorm's powerful mandibles were perfect for cutting down close enemy ranks.

1477.name: Undying Darkhound
1477.description: The Undying Darkhound's parts have graced many battlefields, yet this latest battle may have been the first time they all fought together.

1478.name: Skyskin Hornstrider
1478.description: The instability of primalist storms in potential timelines sometimes causes creatures to absorb the energies from the very storms. These creatures tend to be docile towards those who are able to face the fury of these chronomatic anomalies.

1480.name: Unchained Gladiator's Soul Eater
1480.description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

1481.name: Cartel Master's Gearglider
1481.description: Only the richest cartel leaders are able to afford the metals required to craft the Cartel Master's Gearglider.

1482.name: Xy Trustee's Gearglider
1482.description: Cartel Xy trades in many currencies; none are as valuable to its inner circle as loyalty.

1483.name: Vandal's Gearglider
1483.description: A rarer, customized glider most commonly used for clandestine gatherings. Its silence makes it near impossible to detect, making it a favored tool for those who work in the shadows.

1484.name: Ardenweald Wilderling
1484.description: As anima flows to the distant wealds of Ardenweald once more, the wilderlings awaken and cautiously emerge from their canopy burrows.

1485.name: Autumnal Wilderling
1485.description: The wilderlings are benevolent, magical creatures of Ardenweald, and are drawn to souls that are strong and pure.

1486.name: Winter Wilderling
1486.description: Wilderlings serve as support units in battle, preserving their allies and rendering enemy magics useless.

1487.name: Summer Wilderling
1487.description: Stubborn and rebellious, this wilderling is loyal to very few. But those few are bonded for life.

1489.name: Obsidian Gravewing
1489.description: In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.

1490.name: Sinfall Gravewing
1490.description: With anima once again flowing in Sinfall, the Stonewright has been able to infuse these Stoneborn, making them valuable allies in the battles to come.

1491.name: Pale Gravewing
1491.description: Gravewings know no fear and are nearly indestructible -- perfect for an assault on the Maw.

1492.name: Elysian Aquilon
1492.description: With anima once again flowing to the Eternal Forge in Bastion, the plans for the aquilon centurion could be crafted once more.

1493.name: Forsworn Aquilon
1493.description: Originally produced by the Forsworn with stolen blueprints, these powerful centurion are now earning a reputation across the Shadowlands.

1494.name: Ascendant's Aquilon
1494.description: The aquilon can rapidly transport aspirants, stewards, and even ascended to a location. Hey, sometimes your wings get tired.

1495.name: Maldraxxian Corpsefly
1495.description: Corpseflies were once found throughout Maldraxxus, but many died out in the absence of anima. With anima flowing once again, they swarm.

1496.name: Regal Corpsefly
1496.description: Only the forces of Maldraxxus would call a corpsefly "regal."

1497.name: Battlefield Swarmer
1497.description: Corpseflies are strongly attracted to the smell of dead bodies and will swarm an active battlefield as soon as the first corpse falls.

1500.name: Sanctum Gloomcharger
1500.description: Only the Jailer's most powerful lieutenants are gifted these steeds to stalk the halls of the Tower.

1501.name: Soulbound Gloomcharger
1501.description: Ve'nari has many methods of sneaking around the Maw and disrupting the Jailer's plans, including binding his own minions.

1502.name: Fallen Charger
1502.description: The charger's screams echo across the Maw as it continues a never-ending ride across the land, forever looking for escape from the endless torments it has been forced to endure.

1503.name: Hand of Nilganihmaht
1503.description: Of all the giants who dared defy the Jailer, Nilganihmaht was the most arrogant. For this transgression, the giant's severed hand was hidden within a veil of torments, and the rings that could summon it back were scattered across the Maw.

1504.name: Hand of Salaranga
1504.description: Salaranga was the most cunning of her kin and hid amongst the Beastwarrens. She struck at the Banished One with a horde of bestial allies. It did not matter.

1505.name: Amber Shardhide
1505.description: The bright colors of Korthian wildlife indicate that they have either few predators, or are tough enough to fight back.

1506.name: Crimson Shardhide
1506.description: When Korthia was pulled into The Maw, only a few hardy species survived.

1507.name: Darkmaul
1507.description: An older shardhide, Darkmaul was relatively tame and friendly around Korthians. He was thought lost to the calamity.

1508.name: Fierce Razorwing
1508.description: Razorwings generally stay away from other Korthian species, but with time and patience, they can be tamed as well.

1509.name: Garnet Razorwing
1509.description: Korthia was once known for its bright red flowers. Several species were known for consuming or rolling in them, and taking on bright red coloration as a result.

1510.name: Dusklight Razorwing
1510.description: Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.

1511.name: Maelie, the Wanderer
1511.description: A curious and inquisitive doe, she doesn't mean to worry her master, she just gets distracted easily. Especially with all of the new things to see on Korthia.

1513.name: Sarge's Tale
1513.description: Hold on a sec, Sarge isn't that large, someone must have spun a tall tale in the Hearthstone Tavern...

1514.name: Rampaging Mauler
1514.description: One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.

1517.name: Bound Blizzard
1517.description: A flurrious, fridgid friend, frost-flecked for frozen fun.

1520.name: Soultwisted Deathwalker
1520.description: A howling vortex of tormented souls, ridden only by those who wish to demonstrate their impressive tolerance for pain and suffering.

1521.name: Val'sharah Hippogryph
1521.description: These majestic hippogryphs are as close to a being of the Emerald Dream as any resident of Azeroth can be, and do not bond with a rider easily.

1522.name: Heartlight Vombata
1522.description: The Enlightened revere all creations of the First Ones, yet for many, the vombata of Zereth Mortis are the most beloved. These creatures are equal parts trusted beast of burden and beloved companion.

1523.name: Curious Crystalsniffer
1523.description: Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

1524.name: Darkened Vombata
1524.description: The schematic to synthesize these darkened vombata seem to have appeared as a reaction to the Mawsworn invasion. The resulting vombata look different--darker, much like the invaders--but behave normally.

1525.name: Adorned Vombata
1525.description: Red-colored vombata are considered lucky by the Enlightened. It was a red vombata that was present when they first arrived in Zereth Mortis.

1526.name: Deathrunner
1526.description: These wild cervids are only truly at peace when running through--or between--the lands of Death.

1528.name: Sundered Zerethsteed
1528.description: Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.

1529.name: Anointed Protostag
1529.description: Only those most esteemed by the Enlightened are trusted with the reins of this rare cervid.

1531.name: Wen Lo, the River's Edge
1531.description: The rivers of Pandaria, like Wen Lo, are unpredictable in nature. They may remain calm, bringing water to the crops, or flood, bringing ruin. Wen Lo reminds us that we must adapt to the challenges of life.

1532.name: Soaring Spelltome
1532.description: In the forgotten depths of the Dalaran library, this oversized tome was found flapping madly around the room. Open the pages of this arcane-infused book and hitch a ride to magical adventure.

1533.name: Forged Spiteflyer
1533.description: There's nothing that can make you feel as alive quite like riding through the realm of Death while atop a being that hates you.

1534.name: Buzz
1534.description: Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz! Buzz buzz buzz buzz buzz. Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.

1535.name: Bronzewing Vespoid
1535.description: Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.

1536.name: Mawdapted Raptora
1536.description: Since the Jailer's incursion, new raptora have been synthesized by Zereth Mortis that are capable of resisting the corrupting influence of the Maw.

1537.name: Raptora Swooper
1537.description: The raptora swooper is one of the most vicious iterations of its kind, perfectly suited for its ecological niche. Needing no further adjustments, the ones synthesized today are identical to those created in the past.

1538.name: Bronze Helicid
1538.description: Some helicids of Zereth Mortis have strangely metallic shells. The ones who do are generally a bronze color, indistinct from the metal any novice miner could work, save that this creature's construction far surpasses the skill of any novice.

1539.name: Unsuccessful Prototype Fleetpod
1539.description: This creature was not designed by the First Ones, but instead by an unknown being attempting to create a very fast runner. Needless to say the attempt failed, because this mount is very slow.

1540.name: Scarlet Helicid
1540.description: This helicid's unusual reddish tint is clearly intentional in its design, but the only other difference between these and other helicids is the unusual lack of any ooze.

1541.name: Genesis Crawler
1541.description: The Enlightened who have observed tarachnids believe that this variety may be some of the first beings to ever walk the land of Zereth Mortis.

1542.name: Tarachnid Creeper
1542.description: These tarachnids make their home in the darkest corners of Zereth Mortis, coming out only to hunt (or, sometimes, carry a rider around).

1543.name: Ineffable Skitterer
1543.description: These tarachnids move with a purpose unknown to others, answering only to a higher calling. Whatever that may be, it appears to include routine assistance to mortals who need a ride. For now.

1544.name: Wastewarped Deathwalker
1544.description: Raw swirling energy bound together into a cohesive form, it will only bend to the will of those strong enough to bind it.

1545.name: Divine Kiss of Ohn'ahra
1545.description: ...as though welcomed by the wind itself.

1546.name: Iskaara Trader's Ottuk
1546.description: There are no guarantees when you purchase an ottuk from Tattukiaka. At least they're cute.

1547.name: Goldplate Bufonid
1547.description: This armored bufonid is always ready to leap into battle... as long as that battle is really, really close. In a pinch, it can leap multiple times and eventually reach the battle.

1549.name: Shimmering Aurelid
1549.description: Though it was once created to defend the Sepulcher of the First Ones, with its primary function now completed, it now obediently follows your command.

1550.name: Depthstalker
1550.description: Poached from Zereth Mortis, a few of these jellyfish were lost when the poachers' ship sank. They found a new home in the Great Sea's depths.

1551.name: Cryptic Aurelid
1551.description: The Cyphers of the First Ones are beyond any mortal understanding. A curious effect of the language is that, for reasons unknown, some aurelids are drawn to mortals who aspire to unlock its mystery.

1552.name: Carcinized Zerethsteed
1552.description: The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.

1553.name: Liberated Slyvern
1553.description: It's difficult to tell because it's far too angry, but this slyvern is actually glad it's not owned by gnolls anymore.

1556.name: Tangled Dreamweaver
1556.description: The last of the sleepers are finally awakening, bringing the dreams of the dragons back to the lands.

1563.name: Highland Drake
1563.description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

1564.name: Colossal Soulshredder Mawrat
1564.description: The incredible prowess you have demonstrated within the Jailer's Tower has instilled sufficient respect into this fearsome creature, enabling its use as a mount.

1565.name: Colossal Umbrahide Mawrat
1565.description: This disturbingly large Mawrat is an anomaly amongst its species. These Colossal Mawrats lurk only in the most distant and darkest reaches of Torghast.

1566.name: Colossal Ebonclaw Mawrat
1566.description: This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.

1568.name: Lightforged Ruinstrider
1568.description: A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.

1569.name: Patient Bufonid
1569.description: Some bufonids will sit perfectly still for hours or days at a time if left to their own devices. Fortunately, they're also quite agreeable if a rider would like to move more often than that.

1570.name: Prototype Leaper
1570.description: An ancient schematic allows for the instantiation of this early, but functional, bufonid design.

1571.name: Russet Bufonid
1571.description: Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.

1572.name: Cosmic Gladiator's Soul Eater
1572.description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

1573.name: Magenta Cloud Serpent
1573.description: More affectionate than their cousins, Magenta Cloud Serpents are known to form close bonds with their riders.

1574.name: Crusty Crawler
1574.description: This rare giant crab has taken a break from its nautical nonsense deep under the sea to explore the surface.

1575.name: Quawks
1575.description: Squawks's older (and somehow louder) brother appears to tolerate your presence. For now. You should probably track down some crackers while you still can.

1576.name: Jigglesworth Sr.
1576.description: It's unclear how the saddle stays atop this formerly feline friend, but somehow the House of Plagues made it work. Science.

1577.name: Ash'adar, Harbinger of Dawn
1577.description: Kaldorei legends whisper of a relentless hunter prowling amongst the deepest shadows of Kalimdor, never sleeping. By the light of the sun or the moon, Ash'adar now hunts with you.

1579.name: Coral-Stalker Waveray
1579.description: This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.

1580.name: Heartbond Lupine
1580.description: From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.

1581.name: Nether-Gorged Greatwyrm
1581.description: Few mana wyrms find sufficiently stable sources of arcane power to reach such a size. A greatwyrm's appetite for mana is unmatched.

1582.name: Savage Green Battle Turtle
1582.description: Turtle too slow to chase down your foes? Just add cannons. Nothing can outrun a cannon.

1583.name: Armored Siege Kodo
1583.description: Only the strongest and most fearless of kodos can be trained to become living siege weapons. Even the highest walls won't keep them out for long.

1584.name: Colossal Plaguespew Mawrat
1584.description: These rodents became Iska's infamous sentries, scouting and carrying her plague across the Maw. Their presence is only followed by ruin.

1585.name: Colossal Wraithbound Mawrat
1585.description: Infused by the energies of tormented souls, these creatures have adopted ghostlike abilities that make them quite elusive.

1586.name: Armored Golden Pterrordax
1586.description: Painted and adorned with gold, these Pterrordax patrol the skies over the tomb of Atal'Dazar.

1587.name: Zereth Overseer
1587.description: Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.

1588.name: Winding Slitherdrake
1588.description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

1589.name: Renewed Proto-Drake
1589.description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

1590.name: Windborne Velocidrake
1590.description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

1591.name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
1591.description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

1594.name: Jade, Bright Foreseer
1594.description: The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.

1595.name: Cerulean Marsh Hopper
1595.description: Gottum's expansion into export markets was inevitable with news of the Trading Post reaching even into the depths of the Frogmarsh.

1596.name: Amalgam of Rage
1596.description: The fearsome beast ridden by Astaroth himself is now yours to command.

1597.name: Grimhowl
1597.description: Otherwise known as The Flame Woof, the Fetcher of the Igneous, Molten Core's Best Friend, Forgehound Maximus, the Best Fiery Boy, and "oh no is that an AXE on his face!?"

1599.name: Eternal Gladiator's Soul Eater
1599.description: This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.

1600.name: Elusive Emerald Hawkstrider
1600.description: Unseen for many years, this brightly hued hawkstrider emerged from hiding to help defend the Ghostlands from the Scourge. Its prowess shines as brilliantly as its feathers.

1602.name: Tuskarr Shoreglider
1602.description: The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.

1603.name: Subterranean Magmammoth
1603.description: Awakened from a long slumber, this beast has yet to see the light of day.

1607.name: Swift Spectral Drake
1607.description: Even the dead need a lift every now and then.

1612.name: Loyal Magmammoth
1612.description: Liberated from the Qalashi and harnessed by your ingenuity (and your harness), this magmammoth is ready to lava stomp wherever you want to go.

1614.name: Stormtouched Bruffalon
1614.description: Even from within her prison, Raszageth's primal scorn brought the mightiest beasts to heel.

1615.name: Tamed Skitterfly
1615.description: It didn't take long for Granpap Whiskers to tame the skitterflies around the Dragonscale Basecamp and set them to helping move Expedition personnel and cargo.

1616.name: Azure Skitterfly
1616.description: Once Granpap Whiskers finally taught them how to take riders, the azure skitterflies proved to bond closely and loyally to their riders.

1617.name: Verdant Skitterfly
1617.description: Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.

1618.name: Bestowed Sandskimmer
1618.description: A gift from Granpap Whiskers, these capricious skitterflies help the Timewalkers clean up present (and future) sand-related temporal calamities.

1619.name: Ancient Salamanther
1619.description: Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.

1621.name: Coralscale Salamanther
1621.description: As Raszageth's storms abated, this aquatic breed of salamanther was among the many wonders to settle among the shores in their wake.

1622.name: Stormhide Salamanther
1622.description: Sometimes when storm energies infuse a creature, it simply... becomes larger and more placid. Few salamanthers are willing to be ridden, but these children of the storm are a notable exception.

1623.name: Seething Slug
1623.description: Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.

1626.name: Shellack
1626.description: Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.

1627.name: Gooey Snailemental
1627.description: Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.

1629.name: Scrappy Worldsnail
1629.description: For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.

1633.name: Bestowed Trawling Mammoth
1633.description: A gift from Scout Tomul, so that the feasts of Iskaara will always have enough fish to feed those in need.

1634.name: Mossy Mammoth
1634.description: Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

1635.name: Plainswalker Bearer
1635.description: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.

1638.name: Explorer's Stonehide Packbeast
1638.description: A true explorer never stays in one place for long. Having a reliable packbeast with a strong back and sturdy legs is essential for travel.

1639.name: Lizi, Thunderspine Tramper
1639.description: Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.

1644.name: Raging Magmammoth
1644.description: Most lava flows. This lava charges.

1645.name: Renewed Magmammoth
1645.description: Reforged after destruction at the hands of the Druids of the Flame, this magmammoth is ready to stomp any foes in its path.

1651.name: Bestowed Ottuk Vanguard
1651.description: A gift from Brena, the Iskaara sent their most loyal (and adorable) companions to watch over Kalecgos and his reuinited family in Valdrakken

1653.name: Brown War Ottuk
1653.description: The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.

1654.name: Otterworldly Ottuk Carrier
1654.description: Some ottuks get into the spirit of carrying people around more than others.

1655.name: Yellow War Ottuk
1655.description: The yellow ottuks of the Azure Span are sleek, sneaky, and smart. Those trained for war are the finest tuskarr cavalry mounts, equally capable on the ground and in the waters.

1656.name: Otto
1656.description: Relax. The future will unfold as it was meant to, one way or an otter.

1657.name: Brown Scouting Ottuk
1657.description: Wily and playful in their natural habitat, ottuks possess keen eyes that can scout far afield as ably as they watch for predators.

1658.name: Ivory Trader's Ottuk
1658.description: No adult knows why some ottuks are white, but any tuskarr child can tell you: it's because they eat too much snow.

1659.name: Yellow Scouting Ottuk
1659.description: The yellow scouting ottuk love to hide and they blend in well to their surroundings. When not 'playing' hide and seek with their riders, they are perfect companions when scouting enemy encampments.

1660.name: Crimson Gladiator's Drake
1660.description: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

1662.name: Telix the Stormhorn
1662.description: Once a simple beetle of the Forbidden Reach, Telix became infused with storm magic when Raszageth was unleashed. With its newly heightened senses, Telix roams the Dragon Isles alongside the Dragonscale Expedition--and you!

1664.name: Guardian Vorquin
1664.description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

1665.name: Swift Armored Vorquin
1665.description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

1667.name: Armored Vorquin Leystrider
1667.description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

1668.name: Majestic Armored Vorquin
1668.description: Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.

1669.name: Bestowed Ohuna Spotter
1669.description: A gift from the Ohn'ir, these ohuna are invaluable companions when scouting new horizons for the Dragonscale Expedition.

1671.name: Duskwing Ohuna
1671.description: If you look to the night sky and see the clouds whisk by don't panic. It may just be the illusive Duskwing Ohuna.

1672.name: Zenet Hatchling
1672.description: The hardest winds begin with a gust and a flap.

1674.name: Temperamental Skyclaw
1674.description: Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

1679.name: Frostbrood Proto-Wyrm
1679.description: The same magic of undeath that raised the Frostbrood into the Lich King's service has infused this primal wyrm. Its loyalty and ferocity now serve those who defend Azeroth.

1681.name: Hailstorm Armoredon
1681.description: Born in the middle of an ice storm, this armoredon prefers its meals partially frozen.

1683.name: Crimson Vorquin
1683.description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

1684.name: Sapphire Vorquin
1684.description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

1685.name: Bronze Vorquin
1685.description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

1686.name: Obsidian Vorquin
1686.description: Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

1688.name: Vicious Sabertooth
1688.description: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

1689.name: Vicious Sabertooth
1689.description: The elite Horde forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Thalassian as "pspspspsps".

1692.name: Wondrous Wavewhisker
1692.description: They say one of these magical fish is born when a fisherfolk dreams of the one that got away... and grows bigger with each retelling of the tale.

1698.name: Rocket Shredder 9001
1698.description: The salesgoblin always tells people about the RS-9001's huge variety of attachments, but somehow neglects to mention that you never get to pick the attachments it'll have when you mount up.

1699.name: Gleaming Moonbeast
1699.description: Armored in glistening silver, these devoted mounts are said to be a blessing from Elune herself.

1725.name: Inferno Armoredon
1725.description: Its tail smells like campfire but its breath smells like brimstone.

1727.name: Tarecgosa's Visage
1727.description: "Farewell, Tarecgosa. A dear sister, hero, student, and teacher. Though blood does not bind us, you will always be family. May your soul find its place soaring among the stars."

1729.name: Big Slick in the City
1729.description: Big heart, big dreams, Big Slick.

1730.name: Igneous Shalewing
1730.description: You'd be forgiven for mistaking this creature for a flying volcanic rock. Because to some extent, it is.

1732.name: Cobalt Shalewing
1732.description: Brood of Karokta, raised in the underlight of Zaralek Cavern.

1733.name: Calescent Shalewing
1733.description: A shalewing born in the wake of Fyrakk's destructive breach. Cursed by his primal flame, its temperature slowly but constantly rises. It must immerse itself in water to cool off periodically, lest its own heat smother it.

1734.name: Shadowflame Shalewing
1734.description: Born from the magma, its carapace was originally molten blobs cooled to form dark-colored volcanic rock. Being imbued by shadowflame has only solidified its unbreakable nature.

1735.name: Cataloged Shalewing
1735.description: The first instance of a flaming shalewing ever discovered. Nine out of ten researchers agree: it's hot!

1736.name: Boulder Hauler
1736.description: These shalewings have been specially trained to carry large amounts of Barter Boulders for the niffen's bartering activities.

1737.name: Sandy Shalewing
1737.description: The patterns on the wings of that creature resemble sand flowing through an hourglass. One could gaze upon them for ages...

1738.name: Morsel Sniffer
1738.description: A breed of shalewings trained by the niffen to find the deepest of morsels.

1739.name: Obsidian Gladiator's Slitherdrake
1739.description: This mischievous drake enjoys flying through geysers and volcanic plumes.

1740.name: Vicious War Snail
1740.description: The Alliance uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

1741.name: Vicious War Snail
1741.description: The Horde uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

1742.name: Felcrystal Scorpion
1742.description: The results of a fel infusion experiment with one of Skorpyron's offspring.

1744.name: Grotto Netherwing Drake
1744.description: After traveling to Outland and back, it's only natural these drakes seek out new skies.

1771.name: Highland Drake
1771.description: The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.

1772.name: Scarlet Pterrordax
1772.description: This pterrordax was so eager to take to the skies that its handler couldn't finish training it.

1773.name: Harbor Gryphon
1773.description: This gryphon was the runt of its pride, left behind when its brethren were sent for training. Today, however, it is ready to prove its worth.

1774.name: Valiance
1774.description: Most undead steeds have their riders chosen for them. Valiance, on the other hand, chooses its own rider.

1776.name: White War Wolf
1776.description: Can a wolf's hunger ever be satiated? These lupine brutes seek and devour the enemies of the Horde.

1777.name: Ravenous Black Gryphon
1777.description: War corrupted these once-proud creatures. The susurration of their wings now whispers omens of imminent demise.

1778.name: Gold-Toed Albatross
1778.description: Soaring from a distant timeway, this never-before-seen avian variant was born in a world of order.

1779.name: Felstorm Dragon
1779.description: The Burning Legion defeated dragons in a distant timeway. These foul fel wyrms chose corruption and servitude over destruction.

1781.name: Sulfur Hound
1781.description: The Black Empire subjugated these humbled and hateful hounds. Utterly obedient, they still serve the strong.

1782.name: Perfected Juggernaut
1782.description: Perfection, like beauty, is in the eye of the beholder. But eyesight can be surgically enhanced.

1783.name: Scourgebound Vanquisher
1783.description: Once bound in service to the Scourge, these undead dragons exist only to spread death, disease, and destruction.

1784.name: Royal Swarmer
1784.description: These drones will swarm anyone who dares approach their queen uninvited.

1785.name: Ancestral Clefthoof
1785.description: This clefthoof has seen ages pass, witnessing everything and patiently teaching many to ride.

1786.name: Renewed Proto-Drake
1786.description: As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.

1787.name: Windborne Velocidrake
1787.description: The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.

1788.name: Cliffside Wylderdrake
1788.description: Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

1789.name: Winding Slitherdrake
1789.description: These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.

1792.name: Algarian Stormrider
1792.description: Flying true even in the harshest conditions, this lightning-infused rook was trained to soar through the skies of the Isle of Dorn and into the depths below.

1794.name: Pattie
1794.description: Preservationist Kathos encountered Pattie on her first assignment to Vol'dun. Pattie developed an affinity to Preservationist work but is eager to delve deeper, helping adventurers in their sleuthing.

1795.name: Auspicious Arborwyrm
1795.description: Sprouting to life only once every sixty years, this living wooden dragon combines the patience of a tree and the grace of a dragon in flight.

1797.name: Ginormous Grrloc
1797.description: It's the second biggest murloc you've ever seen!

1798.name: Azure Worldchiller
1798.description: In the corners of Azeroth, stories are told of a dreaded dragon who swept a pall of torment over the land. In some versions of this story, his fiery presence brought cataclysmic death and destruction worldwide. In other versions, he is blue.

1799.name: Eve's Ghastly Rider
1799.description: The preferred transportation of the Fenlow family (especially during Hallow's End).

1801.name: Verdant Armoredon
1801.description: The gnarled horns of this armoredon are far stronger than bone.

1808.name: Blossoming Dreamstag
